var PREBID_TIMEOUT = 300;
var googletag = googletag || {};
googletag.cmd = googletag.cmd || [];
(function (){
    window.advBidxc = window.advBidxc || {};
    window.advBidxc.renderAd = function (){};
    window.advBidxc.startTime = new Date().getTime();
    function loadScript(tagSrc) {
        if (tagSrc.substr(0, 4) !== 'http') {
            var isSSL = 'https:' == document.location.protocol;
            tagSrc = (isSSL ? 'https:' : 'http:') + tagSrc;
        }   
        var scriptTag = document.createElement('script'),
            placeTag = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
        scriptTag.type = 'text/javascript';
        scriptTag.async = true;
        scriptTag.src = tagSrc;
        placeTag.parentNode.insertBefore(scriptTag, placeTag);
    }
    function loadGPT(){
        if(!window.advBidxc.isAdServerLoaded){
            loadScript('//www.googletagservices.com/tag/js/gpt.js');
            window.advBidxc.isAdServerLoaded = true;
        }
    }

    window.advBidxc.loadGPT = loadGPT;
    setTimeout(window.advBidxc.loadGPT,PREBID_TIMEOUT);// Timeout in case of loading error
    var mnSrc = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https:' : 'http:') + '//contextual.media.net/bidexchange.js?cid=8CU2553YN';

})();
</script>

        <div class="user-tools">
            <div id="sharetools-masthead" aria-label="tools" role="group" class="sharetools theme-classic  sharetools-masthead  "
data-shares="email,facebook,twitter,show-all|More"

data-author="By CHARLES M. BLOW"
data-media="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2014/11/01/opinion/blow-circular/blow-circular-jumbo-v2.png"
data-description="What if my son had panicked and the officer had fired? Had I come close to losing him?"
	data-publish-date="January 26, 2015"
>

    <div id="page" class="page">
        <main id="main" class="main" role="main">
                <div id="TopAd" class="ad top-ad nocontent robots-nocontent">

<article id="story" class="story theme-main">

        
    <header id="story-header" class="story-header">
        
                <div id="story-meta" class="story-meta ">
                            <div class="ad sponsortile-ad hidden nocontent robots-nocontent">
                    <div class="caption">Supported by</div>
                    <div id="sponsortile" class="ad sponsortile-ad-creative"></div>
                </div>
                                        <h3 class="kicker">
                        <span class="kicker-label"><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/pages/opinion/index.html">The Opinion Pages</a></span>                            <span class="pipe">|</span>                        Op-Ed Columnist                </h3>
                        			<h2 id="story-heading" class="story-heading">Library Visit, Then Held at Gunpoint</h2>
		<h1 itemprop="headline" id="story-deck" class="deck">Charles Blow: At Yale, the Police Detained My Son</h1>
                            <div id="story-meta-footer" class="story-meta-footer">
                                    <div class="simple-extended-byline">
    <div class="simple-thumb">
        <a href="http://topics.nytimes.com/top/opinion/editorialsandoped/oped/columnists/charles_m_blow/index.html">            <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2014/11/01/opinion/blow-circular/blow-circular-thumbLarge-v5.png" title="Charles M. Blow" />
        </a>    </div>
        <p class="simple-byline-column has-single-author">
                    <a class="simple-byline-column-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/column/charles-m-blow">Charles M. Blow</a>
                <span class='simple-byline-date'>JAN. 26, 2015</span>
    </p>
</div>

                                <p class="byline-dateline">
<time class="dateline" datetime="2015-01-26" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-26">JAN. 26, 2015</time>
</p>

                                                    <div class="inside-story">
                        <span class="menu-label">Inside</span>
                        <ul class="inside-story-menu"></ul>
                    </div>
                                                    <button class="button comments-button  theme-kicker" data-skip-to-para-id="">
</button>
                            </div><!-- close story-meta-footer -->
        </div><!-- close story-meta -->
    </header>

    <div id="story-body" class="story-body">

        
        
        <div class="lede-container">
                        <div class="lede-container-ads">
                                                    <div id="lede-ad" class="ad lede-ad marginalia-anchor-ad nocontent robots-nocontent"><div class="accessibility-ad-header visually-hidden">
    <p>Advertisement</p>
</div>
<a class="visually-hidden skip-to-text-link" href="#story-continues-1">Continue reading the main story</a>
</div>
                                                            </div>
        </div>

        <div id="byline-sharetools-container" class="byline-sharetools-container">
            <div class="extended-byline">
    <div class="thumb">
        <a href="http://topics.nytimes.com/top/opinion/editorialsandoped/oped/columnists/charles_m_blow/index.html">            <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2014/11/01/opinion/blow-circular/blow-circular-thumbLarge-v5.png" title="Charles M. Blow" />
        </a>    </div>
    <p class="byline">
        <span itemprop="author creator" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemid="http://topics.nytimes.com/top/opinion/editorialsandoped/oped/columnists/charles_m_blow/index.html">
            <a href="http://topics.nytimes.com/top/opinion/editorialsandoped/oped/columnists/charles_m_blow/index.html" rel="author" title="More Articles by CHARLES M. BLOW">                <span class="byline-author" data-byline-name="Charles M. Blow" itemprop="name">Charles M. Blow</span>
            </a>        </span>
    </p>
            <div class="follow-button-placeholder" data-collection-id="column.charles-m-blow"></div>
    </div>

                                        <div id="sharetools-story" aria-label="tools" role="group" class="sharetools theme-classic  sharetools-story  "
data-shares="email,facebook|Share,twitter|Tweet,save,show-all|more,ad"
data-url="http://www.nytimes.com/2015/01/26/opinion/charles-blow-at-yale-the-police-detained-my-son.html"
data-title="Charles Blow: At Yale, the Police Detained My Son"
data-author="By CHARLES M. BLOW"
data-media="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2014/11/01/opinion/blow-circular/blow-circular-jumbo-v2.png"
data-description="What if my son had panicked and the officer had fired? Had I come close to losing him?"
	data-publish-date="January 26, 2015"
>
<a class="visually-hidden skip-to-text-link" href="#story-continues-1">Continue reading the main story</a>
<span class="sharetools-label visually-hidden">Share This Page</span>
<div class="ad sharetools-inline-article-ad hidden nocontent robots-nocontent">
<a class="visually-hidden skip-to-text-link" href="#story-continues-1">Continue reading the main story</a>
</div>
<div id="MiddleLeft" class="ad middle-left-ad hidden nocontent robots-nocontent">
<a class="visually-hidden skip-to-text-link" href="#story-continues-1">Continue reading the main story</a>
</div>
</div><!-- close shareTools -->
                    </div>


                
        <p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="197" data-total-count="197" itemprop="articleBody" id="story-continues-1">Saturday evening, I got a call that no parent wants to get. It was my son calling from college — he’s a third-year student at Yale. He had been accosted by a campus police officer, at gunpoint!</p><aside id='middle-right-paid-post-container' class='ad middle-right-ad paid-post-ad hidden nocontent robots-nocontent'>
                                <h2 class='marginalia-heading'></h2>
                                    <ul class='story-menu'>
                                        <li id='MiddleRightPaidPost1' class='story-menu-item ad'></li>
                                        <li id='MiddleRightPaidPost2' class='story-menu-item ad'></li>
                                        <li id='MiddleRightPaidPost3' class='story-menu-item ad'></li>
                                        <li id='MiddleRightPaidPost4' class='story-menu-item ad'></li>
                                    </ul>
                                </aside><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="32" data-total-count="229" itemprop="articleBody" id="story-continues-2">This is how my son remembers it:</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="226" data-total-count="455" itemprop="articleBody">He left for the library around 5:45 p.m. to check the status of a book he had requested. The book hadn’t arrived yet, but since he was there he put in a request for some multimedia equipment for a project he was working on.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="179" data-total-count="634" itemprop="articleBody">Then he left to walk back to his dorm room. He says he saw an officer “jogging” toward the entrance of another building across the grounds from the building he’d just left.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="10" data-total-count="644" itemprop="articleBody">Then this:</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="217" data-total-count="861" itemprop="articleBody">“I did not pay him any mind, and continued to walk back towards my room. I looked behind me, and noticed that the police officer was following me. He spoke into his shoulder-mounted radio and said, ‘I got him.’</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="139" data-total-count="1000" itemprop="articleBody">“I faced forward again, presuming that the officer was not talking to me. I then heard him say, ‘Hey, turn around!’ — which I did.</p><aside class="marginalia collection-marginalia collection collection-type-column collection-tone-opinion collection-section-opinion collection-theme-latest-headlines nocontent robots-nocontent" role="complementary">
    <div class="nocontent robots-nocontent">
                <header>
                        <div class="thumb">
                <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2014/11/01/opinion/blow-circular/blow-circular-blogSmallThumb-v2.png" alt="" />
            </div>
                        <div class="collection-meta">
                <div class="follow-button-placeholder" data-collection-id="column.charles-m-blow"></div>
                <h2 class="collection-marginalia-heading"><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/column/charles-m-blow">Charles M. Blow</a></h2>
                <h3 class="collection-marginalia-subheading">Politics, public opinion and social justice.</h3>
            </div>
        </header>
        <ul>
                        <li><article class="story theme-summary">
    <a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/24/opinion/a-year-without-tamir.html?rref=collection%2Fcolumn%2FCharles M. Blow">
        <h2 class="story-heading">
            <span class="story-heading-text">
                                A Year Without Tamir            </span>
            <time class="dateline" datetime="2015-11-23">NOV 23</time>
        </h2>
    </a>
</article>
</li>
                        <li><article class="story theme-summary">
    <a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/23/opinion/anti-muslim-is-anti-american.html?rref=collection%2Fcolumn%2FCharles M. Blow">
        <h2 class="story-heading">
            <span class="story-heading-text">
                                Anti-Muslim Is Anti-American            </span>
            <time class="dateline" datetime="2015-11-23">NOV 23</time>
        </h2>
    </a>
</article>
</li>
                        <li><article class="story theme-summary">
    <a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/16/opinion/race-college-and-safe-space.html?rref=collection%2Fcolumn%2FCharles M. Blow">
        <h2 class="story-heading">
            <span class="story-heading-text">
                                Race, College and Safe Space            </span>
            <time class="dateline" datetime="2015-11-16">NOV 16</time>
        </h2>
    </a>
</article>
</li>
                        <li><article class="story theme-summary">
    <a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/12/opinion/campaign-stops/gop-debate-doldrums.html?rref=collection%2Fcolumn%2FCharles M. Blow">
        <h2 class="story-heading">
            <span class="story-heading-text">
                                G.O.P. Debate Doldrums            </span>
            <time class="dateline" datetime="2015-11-12">NOV 12</time>
        </h2>
    </a>
</article>
</li>
                        <li><article class="story theme-summary">
    <a class="story-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/09/opinion/ben-carson-and-the-truth.html?rref=collection%2Fcolumn%2FCharles M. Blow">
        <h2 class="story-heading">
            <span class="story-heading-text">
                                Ben Carson and the Truth            </span>
            <time class="dateline" datetime="2015-11-09">NOV 9</time>
        </h2>
    </a>
</article>
</li>
                    </ul>
        <footer>
            <p class="user-action"><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/column/charles-m-blow">See More &raquo;</a></p>
        </footer>
    </div><!-- close nocontent -->
</aside>
<p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="71" data-total-count="1071" itemprop="articleBody">“The officer raised his gun at me, and told me to get on the ground.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="180" data-total-count="1251" itemprop="articleBody">“At this point, I stopped looking directly at the officer, and looked down towards the pavement. I dropped to my knees first, with my hands raised, then laid down on my stomach.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="62" data-total-count="1313" itemprop="articleBody">“The officer asked me what my name was. I gave him my name.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="75" data-total-count="1388" itemprop="articleBody">“The officer asked me what school I went to. I told him Yale University.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="51" data-total-count="1439" itemprop="articleBody">“At this point, the officer told me to get up.”</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="83" data-total-count="1522" itemprop="articleBody">The officer gave his name, then asked my son to “give him a call the next day.”</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="17" data-total-count="1539" itemprop="articleBody">My son continued:</p><aside class="marginalia comments-marginalia  featured-comment-marginalia" data-marginalia-type="sprinkled" data-skip-to-para-id="story-continues-3">
</aside>
<p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="204" data-total-count="1743" itemprop="articleBody" id="story-continues-3">“I got up slowly, and continued to walk back to my room. I was scared. My legs were shaking slightly. After a few more paces, the officer said, ‘Hey, my man. Can you step off to the side?’ I did.”</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="191" data-total-count="1934" itemprop="articleBody">The officer asked him to turn around so he could see the back of his jacket. He asked his name again, then, finally, asked to see my son’s ID. My son produced his school ID from his wallet.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="138" data-total-count="2072" itemprop="articleBody">The officer asked more questions, and my son answered. All the while the officer was relaying this information to someone over his radio.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="233" data-total-count="2305" itemprop="articleBody">My son heard someone on the radio say back to the officer “something to the effect of: ‘Keep him there until we get this sorted out.’ ” The officer told my son that an incident report would be filed, and then he walked away.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="268" data-total-count="2573" itemprop="articleBody">A female officer approached. My son recalled, “I told her that an officer had just stopped me and pointed his gun at me, and that I wanted to know what this was all about.” She explained students had called about a burglary suspect who fit my son’s description.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="56" data-total-count="2629" itemprop="articleBody">That suspect was <a href="http://yaledailynews.com/blog/2015/01/25/after-thwarted-theft-attempt-in-trumbull-ypd-arrests-intruder/">apparently later arrested in the area</a>.</p><aside class="marginalia comments-marginalia  selected-comment-marginalia" data-marginalia-type="sprinkled" data-skip-to-para-id="story-continues-4">
</aside>
<p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="65" data-total-count="2694" itemprop="articleBody" id="story-continues-4">When I spoke to my son, he was shaken up. I, however, was fuming.</p><aside class="marginalia comments-marginalia  comment-prompt-marginalia" data-marginalia-type="sprinkled" data-skip-to-para-id="story-continues-5">
</aside>
<p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="334" data-total-count="3028" itemprop="articleBody" id="story-continues-5">Now, don’t get me wrong: If indeed my son matched the description of a suspect, I would have had no problem with him being questioned appropriately. School is his community, his home away from home, and he would have appreciated reasonable efforts to keep it safe. The stop is not the problem; the method of the stop is the problem.</p><div id="MiddleRight1" class="ad ad-placeholder nocontent robots-nocontent"><div class="accessibility-ad-header visually-hidden">
    <p>Advertisement</p>
</div>
<a class="visually-hidden skip-to-text-link" href="#story-continues-6">Continue reading the main story</a>
</div>
    	<div id="MiddleRightN" class="ad text-ad middle-right-ad nocontent robots-nocontent"><div class="accessibility-ad-header visually-hidden">
    <p>Advertisement</p>
</div>
<a class="visually-hidden skip-to-text-link" href="#story-continues-6">Continue reading the main story</a>
</div><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="112" data-total-count="3140" itemprop="articleBody" id="story-continues-6">Why was a gun drawn first? Why was he not immediately told why he was being detained? Why not ask for ID first?</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="249" data-total-count="3389" itemprop="articleBody">What if my son had panicked under the stress, having never had a gun pointed at him before, and made what the officer considered a “suspicious” movement? Had I come close to losing him? Triggers cannot be unpulled. Bullets cannot be called back.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="136" data-total-count="3525" itemprop="articleBody">My son was unarmed, possessed no plunder, obeyed all instructions, answered all questions, did not attempt to flee or resist in any way.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="308" data-total-count="3833" itemprop="articleBody">This is the scenario I have always dreaded: my son at the wrong end of a gun barrel, face down on the concrete. I had always dreaded the moment that we would share stories about encounters with the police in which our lives hung in the balance, intergenerational stories of joining the inglorious “club.”</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="208" data-total-count="4041" itemprop="articleBody">When that moment came, I was exceedingly happy I had talked to him about how to conduct himself if a situation like this ever occurred. Yet I was brewing with sadness and anger that he had to use that advice.</p><button class="button comments-button  theme-speech-bubble" data-skip-to-para-id="story-continues-7">
</button>
<p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="240" data-total-count="4281" itemprop="articleBody" id="story-continues-7">I am reminded of what I have always known, but what some would choose to deny: that there is no way to work your way out — earn your way out — of this sort of crisis. In these moments, what you’ve done matters less than how you look.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="104" data-total-count="4385" itemprop="articleBody">There is no amount of respectability that can bend a gun’s barrel. All of our boys are bound together.</p><p class="story-body-text story-content" data-para-count="275" data-total-count="4660" itemprop="articleBody">The dean of Yale College and the campus police chief have apologized and promised an internal investigation, and I appreciate that. But the scars cannot be unmade. My son will always carry the memory of the day he left his college library and an officer trained a gun on him.</p>
        
                                        <footer class="story-footer story-content">
    <div class="story-meta">
                        <div class="story-info"><p>I invite you to join me on <a href="http://www.facebook.com/CharlesMBlow">Facebook</a> and follow me on <a href="http://twitter.com/CharlesMBlow">Twitter</a>, or e-mail me at <a href="mailto:chblow@nytimes.com">chblow@nytimes.com</a>.</p></div>

        
        <p class="story-print-citation">A version of this op-ed appears in print on January 26, 2015, on page A21 of the <span itemprop="printEdition">New York edition</span> with the headline: Library Visit, Then Held at Gunpoint. <span class="story-footer-links">  <span><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/pages/todayspaper/index.html" target="_blank">Today's Paper</a><span class="pipe">|</span></span><span><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/subscriptions/Multiproduct/lp839RF.html?campaignId=48JQY" target="_blank">Subscribe</a></span>
</span>
</p>
    </div><!-- close story-meta -->
    </footer>

        
                    <nav id="next-in"></nav><!-- close next-in -->
            </div><!-- close story-body -->
</article>

    require(['article/main']);

        if (window.location.search.indexOf('disable_tagx') > 0) {
            return;
        }

            require(['http://static01.nyt.com/bi/js/tagx/tagx.js'], function () {

            <div class="message">
                <span class="message-content">
                    <i class="icon alert-icon"></i><span class="message-title">NYTimes.com no longer supports Internet Explorer 9 or earlier. Please upgrade your browser.</span>
                    <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/content/help/site/ie9-support.html" class="action-link">LEARN MORE »</a>
                </span>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

        <main id="main" class="main" role="main">

<article id="story" class="story theme-interactive 
    theme-main 
    ">
                
    <header class="story-header interactive-header">
                        <div class="story-meta">
                                                                <div class="kicker-container">
                <h2 class="kicker interactive-kicker">
                                        <span class="kicker-label">
                        <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/pages/politics/index.html">
                            Politics                        </a>
                    </span>
                                                                            </h2>
                                    <div id="sharetools-interactive" aria-label="tools" role="group" class="sharetools theme-classic  sharetools-interactive  "
data-shares="show-all|Share"
data-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/us/politics/attorneys-general.html"
data-title="Courting Favor"
data-author=""
data-media="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2014/10/29/us/politics/sub-AG/sub-AG-jumbo-v3.jpg"
data-description="In a series of articles, Eric Lipton of The New York Times examines the explosion in lobbying of state attorneys general by corporate interests and the millions in campaign donations they now provide."
	data-publish-date="March 15, 2015"
>
<div class="ad sharetools-inline-article-ad hidden nocontent robots-nocontent">
</div>
</div><!-- close shareTools -->
                            </div>
                                    <h1 class="story-heading interactive-headline" itemprop="headline">Courting Favor</h1>
            
            <div class="story-meta-footer interactive-meta-footer">
                                 <p class="interactive-leadin summary">
            <span class="summary-text">In a series of articles, Eric Lipton of The New York Times examines the explosion in lobbying of state attorneys general by corporate interests and the millions in campaign donations they now provide.</span>
    
        			        	<time class="dateline" datetime="2015-03-15" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-15">MARCH 15, 2015</time>
	    	                                </p>
            </div><!-- close story-meta-footer -->

        </div><!-- close story-meta -->
        </header>
    <div id="attorneys-general" class="interactive-graphic">
         <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2014/04/09/procedures/a058f2355b7520ca0b6fd144ed1655883e6caa53/build.css">
    <section class="section-01 Colonoscopy clearfix">
        <div class="contents">
            <div class="section-meta">
                <span class="part-order">Part 1</span>
                <span class="part-kicker"><i class="icon"></i>‘The People’s Lawyers’</span>
                <h2><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/29/us/lobbyists-bearing-gifts-pursue-attorneys-general.html">Lobbyists, Bearing Gifts, Pursue Attorneys General</a></h2>
            </div>
            <figure>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/29/us/lobbyists-bearing-gifts-pursue-attorneys-general.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2014/10/29/us/politics/sub-AG/sub-AG-custom1-v2.jpg"></a>
            <figcaption class="caption" itemprop="caption description">
	<span class="caption-text">Emails detail interactions between the office of Attorney General Pam Bondi of Florida and a law firm trying to sway her.</span>
	<span class="credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">Alex Wong/Getty Images</span>
</figcaption>
            </figure>
            <p class="summary">
                Attorneys general have become the object of pursuit by lobbyists who use campaign contributions, personal appeals and other means to sway investigations or negotiate favorable deals, an investigation by The New York Times has found.
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/29/us/lobbyists-bearing-gifts-pursue-attorneys-general.html" class="read-link">Read Article &raquo;</a>
            </p>
        </div>
        <div class="in-article">
            <b>In This Article</b>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/10/28/us/politics/money-going-to-state-attorneys-general.html"><span data-name="Graphic: Money Going to Attorneys General" class="icon"></span>Graphic: Money Going to Attorneys General</a>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/10/28/us/politics/ag-docs.html"><span data-name="Documents: Lobbying State Attorneys General" class="icon"></span>Documents: Lobbying State Attorneys General</a>
        </div>
        <div class="related ">
            <b>Follow-up Coverage</b>
 <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/30/us/politics/missouris-attorney-general-faces-scrutiny.html">Missouri Attorney General May Face Inquiry Over Money From Lobbyists</a>
 <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/01/us/politics/attorney-generals-political-donations-eric-schneiderman-john-cahill.html">Donations Are Assailed by Hopefuls in New York</a>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/10/us/link-shows-how-lobby-firm-cultivates-influence.html">Link Shows How Lobby Firm Cultivates Influence</a>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/20/us/missouri-attorney-general-chris-koster-puts-limit-on-contributions.html">Missouri Attorney General Puts Limit on Contributions</a>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/22/us/rhode-island-investigating-ex-attorney-general-on-lobbying-rule.html">Rhode Island Investigating Former State Attorney General</a>




        </div>
    </section>
<section class="section-05 Prescriptions clearfix">
        <div class="contents">
            <div class="section-meta">
                <span class="part-order">Part 2</span>
                <span class="part-kicker"><i class="icon"></i>A Hidden Coalition</span>
                <h2><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/07/us/politics/energy-firms-in-secretive-alliance-with-attorneys-general.html">Energy Firms in Secretive Alliance With Attorneys General</a></h2>
            </div>
            <figure>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/07/us/politics/energy-firms-in-secretive-alliance-with-attorneys-general.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2014/12/07/us/politics/AG/AG-custom1.jpg"></a>
            <figcaption class="caption" itemprop="caption description">
	<span class="caption-text">Attorney General Scott Pruitt of Oklahoma, second from right, in Dallas in July, and his Republican counterparts have formed alliances to oppose federal regulations.</span>
	<span class="credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">Dylan Hollingsworth for The New York Times</span>
</figcaption>
            </figure>
            <p class="summary">
                Republican attorneys general have formed an unprecedented, secretive alliance with some of the nation’s top energy producers to push back against the Obama regulatory agenda, an investigation by The New York Times has found.
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/07/us/politics/energy-firms-in-secretive-alliance-with-attorneys-general.html" class="read-link">Read Article &raquo;</a>
            </p>
        </div>
      <div class="in-article">
            <b>In This Article</b>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/12/07/us/politics/documents-attorneys-general-and-the-energy-industry.html"><span data-name="Documents: A Window Into a Secret Alliance: Attorneys General and the Energy Industry" class="icon"></span>Documents: A Window Into a Secret Alliance: Attorneys General and the Energy Industry</a>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/12/07/us/politics/oklahoma-attorney-general-letter-written-almost-entirely-by-energy-company.html"><span data-name="Graphic: A Letter From Oklahoma's Attorney General, Written Almost Entirely by Energy Company Officials" class="icon"></span>Graphic: A Letter From Oklahoma's Attorney General, Written Almost Entirely by Energy Company Officials</a>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/07/us/politics/energy-firms-in-secretive-alliance-with-attorneys-general.html#more-of-nations-top-lawyers-are-republican"><span data-name="Graphic: More of Nation’s Attorneys General Are Republican" class="icon"></span>Graphic: More of Nation’s Attorneys General Are Republican</a>
                 <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/07/us/politics/energy-firms-in-secretive-alliance-with-attorneys-general.html#top-individual-recipients-of-energy-industry-money"><span data-name="Graphic: Top Individual Recipients of Energy Industry Money Since 2004" class="icon"></span>Graphic: Top Individual Recipients of Energy Industry Money Since 2004</a>
        </div>
    </section>
 <section class="section-03 Joint-Replacement clearfix">
        <div class="contents">
            <div class="section-meta">
                <span class="part-order">Part 3</span>
                <span class="part-kicker"><i class="icon"></i>The Pitch</span>
                <h2><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/19/us/politics/lawyers-create-big-paydays-by-coaxing-attorneys-general-to-sue-.html">Lawyers Create Big Paydays by Coaxing Attorneys General to Sue</a></h2>
            </div>
            <figure>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/19/us/politics/lawyers-create-big-paydays-by-coaxing-attorneys-general-to-sue-.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2014/12/19/us/JP-AG2/JP-AG2-custom1.jpg"></a>
            <figcaption class="caption" itemprop="caption description">
	<span class="caption-text">Attorney General Gary King of New Mexico was asked by Linda Singer, a former District of Columbia attorney general, to consider suing the owner of a Gallup nursing home, but then her target shifted.</span>
	<span class="credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">Craig Fritz/Associated Press</span>
</figcaption>
            </figure>
            <p class="summary">
               A flourishing industry pairs plaintiffs’ lawyers with attorneys general to sue companies, setting off a furious competition among trial lawyers and lobbyists to influence these officials.
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/19/us/politics/lawyers-create-big-paydays-by-coaxing-attorneys-general-to-sue-.html" class="read-link">Read Article &raquo;</a>
            </p>
        </div>
        <div class="in-article">
            <b>In This Article</b>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/12/19/us/politics/Alliance-that-Enriches-All-Sides-Plaintiffs-Lawyers-and-Attorneys-General-Documents.html"><span data-name="Documents: An Alliance That Enriches All Sides: Plaintiffs’ Lawyers and Attorneys General" class="icon"></span>Documents: An Alliance That Enriches All Sides: Plaintiffs’ Lawyers and Attorneys General</a>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/12/19/us/politics/political-gifts-from-plaintiffs-lawyers.html"><span data-name="Graphic: Political Gifts from Plaintiffs’ Lawyers" class="icon"></span>Graphic: Political Gifts from Plaintiffs’ Lawyers</a>
        </div>
<div class="related ">
            <b>Additional Follow-up Coverage</b>
                <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/21/opinion/attorneys-general-for-sale.html">Editorial: Attorneys General for Sale</a>
 <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/17/technology/googles-critics-enlist-state-attorneys-general-in-their-fight.html">Google’s Detractors Take Their Fight to the States</a>
 <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/20/technology/google-attorney-general-jim-hood-lawsuit.html">Sued by Google, a State Attorney General Retreats</a>
 <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/27/us/bipartisan-effort-to-restrict-lobbyists-influence-of-attorneys-general.html">A Bipartisan Push to Limit Lobbyists’ Sway Over Attorneys General</a>
        </div>
    </section>

            <li><a href="https://myaccount.nytimes.com/membercenter/feedback.html">Site Feedback</a></li>
            <li class="wide-viewport-item last-item"><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/subscriptions/Multiproduct/lp5558.html?campaignId=37WXW">Subscriptions</a></li>
        </ul>
    </nav>
</footer>
        </div><!-- close page -->
    </div><!-- close shell -->
    <script>
require(['foundation/main'], function () {
    require(['interactive/main']);
    require(['jquery/nyt', 'foundation/views/page-manager'], function ($, pageManager) {
        if (window.location.search.indexOf('disable_tagx') > 0) {
            return;
        }
        $(document).ready(function () {
            require(['http://static01.nyt.com/bi/js/tagx/tagx.js'], function () {
                pageManager.trackingFireEventQueue();
            });
        });
    });
});

                                                                            <h1 class="story-heading interactive-headline" itemprop="headline">52 Places to Go in 2015</h1>
            
            <div class="story-meta-footer interactive-meta-footer">
                                 <p class="interactive-leadin summary">
            <span class="summary-text">Untrammeled oases beckon, once-avoided destinations become must-sees and familiar cities offer new reasons to visit.</span>
    
        			        	<time class="dateline" datetime="July 7, 2015"><span class="timestamp">UPDATED </span>July 7, 2015</time>

      <div id="g-story-milan" class="g-story g-hasVideo"
  data-slug="milan">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-milan_9"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/milan-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">1.</span> Milan, Italy</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A revitalized city welcomes the world. </p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Sure, Italy is rich with romantic cities like Florence, Venice and Rome &#x2014; but its most vibrant might just be Milan. And this is the year for tourists to explore its charms, as it hosts the <a href="http://www.expo2015.org/en/index.html?packedargs=op=changeLang">2015 World Expo</a>.</p><p>Twenty million visitors are expected to visit the city for the Expo, a mammoth event that runs from May through October and involves more than 130 participating nations and organizations sponsoring more than 60 pavilions. The Expo&#x2019;s theme focuses on food, nutrition and sustainability practices &#x2014; a fitting choice for a city steeped in Italian culinary traditions. Highlights will include the<a href="http://www.expo2015.org/en/future-food-district"> Future Food District</a>, a space to explore technological advances affecting the global food chain, and the<a href="http://www.expo2015.org/en/explore/exhibition-site/lake-arena"> Lake Arena</a>, an Expo centerpiece with a mirrorlike pond and fountain fed by water from the city&#x2019;s canals.</p><p>The Expo coincides with the completion of a number of urban renewal projects that are infusing new life into overlooked quarters, like<a href="http://www.expo2015.org/en/milan-s-darsena"> La Darsena</a>, a formerly dilapidated harbor that will feature tree-lined promenades, bike paths and piazzas. Historical attractions have also been spruced up, from the gleaming facade of the majestic<a href="http://duomomilano.it"> Duomo</a> to the restored canals of the charming Navigli district.</p><p>And Milanese restaurants are earning acclaim for their increased focus on diverse regional cuisines from across the Italian peninsula. You can sample everything from farinata and pesto-slathered Genovese specialties at<a href="http://ubarba.it"> U Barba</a> to traditional Neapolitan pizza at Lievito Madre al Duomo, an outpost of Gino Sorbillo&#x2019;s famous<a href="http://sorbillo.it"> pizzeria</a> that opened here last fall. New luxury hotels, like the Mandarin Oriental Milan slated to open this year, promise to dress up an already fashionable city that may just have it all.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Ingrid K. Williams</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The spires of Milan's massive Duomo. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Isabella de Maddalena for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="milan" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/milan-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=milan" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Milan, Italy">

  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825385747518531">Do you know Milan? Tell us what to see.</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825385747518531">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Spend 10 minutes for the small San Satiro church, just 5 minutes walk from Piazza del Duomo, with an absolutely incredible trompe-l'oeil altar fresco.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>

            </noscript>
            <!-- laziestloader container -->
<div 
id="g-media-milan_11"
data-ratio="0.66666667"
data-slug="milan"
class="g-lazy-video g-lazy-media">
  <!-- vhs container -->
  <div id="g-media-milan_11_vhs" class="g-vhs"></div>
</div>

            <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
                <span class="g-caption-text">The Duomo. </span>
                <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                    <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                    Chris Carmichael for The New York Times
                </span>
            </figcaption>
          </figure>
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A revitalized city welcomes the world. </p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Sure, Italy is rich with romantic cities like Florence, Venice and Rome &#x2014; but its most vibrant might just be Milan. And this is the year for tourists to explore its charms, as it hosts the <a href="http://www.expo2015.org/en/index.html?packedargs=op=changeLang">2015 World Expo</a>.</p><p>Twenty million visitors are expected to visit the city for the Expo, a mammoth event that runs from May through October and involves more than 130 participating nations and organizations sponsoring more than 60 pavilions. The Expo&#x2019;s theme focuses on food, nutrition and sustainability practices &#x2014; a fitting choice for a city steeped in Italian culinary traditions. Highlights will include the<a href="http://www.expo2015.org/en/future-food-district"> Future Food District</a>, a space to explore technological advances affecting the global food chain, and the<a href="http://www.expo2015.org/en/explore/exhibition-site/lake-arena"> Lake Arena</a>, an Expo centerpiece with a mirrorlike pond and fountain fed by water from the city&#x2019;s canals.</p><p>The Expo coincides with the completion of a number of urban renewal projects that are infusing new life into overlooked quarters, like<a href="http://www.expo2015.org/en/milan-s-darsena"> La Darsena</a>, a formerly dilapidated harbor that will feature tree-lined promenades, bike paths and piazzas. Historical attractions have also been spruced up, from the gleaming facade of the majestic<a href="http://duomomilano.it"> Duomo</a> to the restored canals of the charming Navigli district.</p><p>And Milanese restaurants are earning acclaim for their increased focus on diverse regional cuisines from across the Italian peninsula. You can sample everything from farinata and pesto-slathered Genovese specialties at<a href="http://ubarba.it"> U Barba</a> to traditional Neapolitan pizza at Lievito Madre al Duomo, an outpost of Gino Sorbillo&#x2019;s famous<a href="http://sorbillo.it"> pizzeria</a> that opened here last fall. New luxury hotels, like the Mandarin Oriental Milan slated to open this year, promise to dress up an already fashionable city that may just have it all.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Ingrid K. Williams</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2015/01/11/travel/what-to-do-in-36-hours-in-milan.html"><span>Related:</span> “36 Hours: What To Do in Milan“</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="milan" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/milan-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=milan" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Milan, Italy">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Milan, Italy is No. 1 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/milan-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>

      <div id="g-story-cuba" class="g-story "
  data-slug="cuba">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-cuba_14"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/cuba-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">2.</span> Cuba</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">As relations warm, a Caribbean island is within reach.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Cuba has long been the forbidden island, a tropical bastion of communism whose mystique was amplified by the fact it was largely off limits to Americans. Now, as part of the d&#xE9;tente between the United States and Cuba, Americans wishing to go there will face fewer restrictions, provided their visit is &quot;purposeful&quot; (strictly sun-and-sand holidays are still prohibited). The opening comes as life on the island is gradually changing &#x2014; not fast enough for many Cubans, but slowly enough that those wanting to glimpse a crumbling socialist system, see the miles of undeveloped, glittering coastline and strike up a conversation in the back of a battered Oldsmobile still have time. While the issue of travel there is still politically polarizing in the United States, the travel industry is embracing this potential new Caribbean destination with full force. The good news, for Cubans and their visitors, is that the economic reforms &#x2014; however limited &#x2014; have created a constellation of privately-run restaurants and bars in Havana and provincial towns, many of them in beautiful, restored homes. An effort by the government to reinject life into Havana&#x2019;s cultural scene has spawned vibrant new venues like the <a href="https://www.facebook.com/fabricadeartecubano.cu">Fabrica de Arte Cubano</a>, where the young, hip and better-off line up on weekends. Given the <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/19/travel/how-travel-to-cuba-may-change.html">sharp rise expected</a> in the number of Americans visiting, travelers should book early if they want somewhere to sleep during the <a href="http://www.bienalhabana.cult.cu/">12th Havana Biennial</a>, May 22 to June 22, an event that &#x2014; as if to prove Cuba still operates at its own pace &#x2014; rarely happens at two year intervals.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Victoria Burnett</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Colorful homes in Old Havana.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Lisette Poole for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="cuba" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/cuba-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=cuba" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Cuba">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Cuba is No. 2 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/cuba-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Cuba" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Cuba: As relations warm, a Caribbean island is within reach. / #2 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/cuba-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Cuba">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825394580850981">What did we miss in Cuba? Share your tips.</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825394580850981">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Old Havana is brimming with charm, but don't forget places to the south like Cienfuegos and Trinidad. Flat out beautiful!“ <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">2.</span> Cuba</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/cuba-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/cuba-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Cuba">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-cuba_13"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"

>
          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">Colorful homes in Old Havana.</span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">

                  Lisette Poole for The New York Times
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">As relations warm, a Caribbean island is within reach.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Cuba has long been the forbidden island, a tropical bastion of communism whose mystique was amplified by the fact it was largely off limits to Americans. Now, as part of the d&#xE9;tente between the United States and Cuba, Americans wishing to go there will face fewer restrictions, provided their visit is &quot;purposeful&quot; (strictly sun-and-sand holidays are still prohibited). The opening comes as life on the island is gradually changing &#x2014; not fast enough for many Cubans, but slowly enough that those wanting to glimpse a crumbling socialist system, see the miles of undeveloped, glittering coastline and strike up a conversation in the back of a battered Oldsmobile still have time. While the issue of travel there is still politically polarizing in the United States, the travel industry is embracing this potential new Caribbean destination with full force. The good news, for Cubans and their visitors, is that the economic reforms &#x2014; however limited &#x2014; have created a constellation of privately-run restaurants and bars in Havana and provincial towns, many of them in beautiful, restored homes. An effort by the government to reinject life into Havana&#x2019;s cultural scene has spawned vibrant new venues like the <a href="https://www.facebook.com/fabricadeartecubano.cu">Fabrica de Arte Cubano</a>, where the young, hip and better-off line up on weekends. Given the <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/19/travel/how-travel-to-cuba-may-change.html">sharp rise expected</a> in the number of Americans visiting, travelers should book early if they want somewhere to sleep during the <a href="http://www.bienalhabana.cult.cu/">12th Havana Biennial</a>, May 22 to June 22, an event that &#x2014; as if to prove Cuba still operates at its own pace &#x2014; rarely happens at two year intervals.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Victoria Burnett</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/caribbean-and-bermuda/cuba/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Cuba Coverage</a></li>
</ul>

      <div id="g-story-philadelphia" class="g-story g-hasVideo"
  data-slug="philadelphia">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-philadelphia_19"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/philadelphia-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">3.</span> Philadelphia</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">The making of an urban outdoor oasis.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>A series of projects has transformed Philadelphia into a hive of outdoor urban activity.<a href="http://www.ccdparks.org/dilworth-park"> Dilworth Park</a>, formerly a hideous slab of concrete adjoining City Hall, reopened this past autumn as a green, pedestrian-friendly public space with a winter ice-skating rink (and a cafe by the indefatigable chef<a href="http://garcesgroup.com/"> Jose Garces</a>). Public art installations, mini &quot;parklets&quot; and open-air beer gardens have become common sights. The<a href="http://www.delawareriverwaterfront.com/"> Delaware River waterfront</a> was reworked for summer 2014 with the<a href="http://www.delawareriverwaterfront.com/places/spruce-street-harbor-park"> Spruce Street Harbor Park</a> (complete with hammocks, lanterns and floating bar) becoming a new fixture, following the renovation of the Race Street Pier, completed in 2011, and offers free yoga classes on a bi-level strip of high-design decking and grass. The city&#x2019;s other river, the Schuylkill, has its own new<a href="http://www.schuylkillbanks.org/projects/boardwalk-and-south-street-ramp"> boardwalk</a>. To top it off, this spring, Philadelphia will get its first<a href="http://www.phillybikeshare.com/page/bikeshare"> bike share program</a>, making this mostly flat city even more friendly for those on two wheels.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Nell McShane Wulfhart</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The Schuylkill River Trail.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Sam Oberter for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="philadelphia" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/philadelphia-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=philadelphia" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Philadelphia">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Philadelphia is No. 3 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/philadelphia-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Philadelphia" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Philadelphia: The making of an urban outdoor oasis. / #3 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/philadelphia-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Philadelphia">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">3.</span> Philadelphia</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/philadelphia-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/philadelphia-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Philadelphia">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-philadelphia_18"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/philadelphia-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"
>
          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">The Schuylkill River Trail.</span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                  <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                  Sam Oberter for The New York Times
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        
          <figure
            class="g-figure-video"
            itemprop="associatedMedia"
            itemscope=""
            itemid=""
            itemtype="http://schema.org/VideoObject"
            aria-label="media"
            role="group">
            <span class="visually-hidden">Video Player</span>
            <noscript>
              <video autoplay="" loop="" muted="" preload="none" poster="">
                  <source id="mp4" src="" type="video/mp4">
                  <img src="">
              </video>
            </noscript>
            <!-- laziestloader container -->
<div 
id="g-media-philadelphia_21"
data-ratio="0.66666667"
data-slug="philadelphia"
class="g-lazy-video g-lazy-media">
  <!-- vhs container -->
  <div id="g-media-philadelphia_21_vhs" class="g-vhs"></div>
</div>

            <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
                <span class="g-caption-text">The Schuylkill River Trail.</span>
                <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                    <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                    Sam Oberter for The New York Times
                </span>
            </figcaption>
          </figure>
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">The making of an urban outdoor oasis.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>A series of projects has transformed Philadelphia into a hive of outdoor urban activity.<a href="http://www.ccdparks.org/dilworth-park"> Dilworth Park</a>, formerly a hideous slab of concrete adjoining City Hall, reopened this past autumn as a green, pedestrian-friendly public space with a winter ice-skating rink (and a cafe by the indefatigable chef<a href="http://garcesgroup.com/"> Jose Garces</a>). Public art installations, mini &quot;parklets&quot; and open-air beer gardens have become common sights. The<a href="http://www.delawareriverwaterfront.com/"> Delaware River waterfront</a> was reworked for summer 2014 with the<a href="http://www.delawareriverwaterfront.com/places/spruce-street-harbor-park"> Spruce Street Harbor Park</a> (complete with hammocks, lanterns and floating bar) becoming a new fixture, following the renovation of the Race Street Pier, completed in 2011, and offers free yoga classes on a bi-level strip of high-design decking and grass. The city&#x2019;s other river, the Schuylkill, has its own new<a href="http://www.schuylkillbanks.org/projects/boardwalk-and-south-street-ramp"> boardwalk</a>. To top it off, this spring, Philadelphia will get its first<a href="http://www.phillybikeshare.com/page/bikeshare"> bike share program</a>, making this mostly flat city even more friendly for those on two wheels.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Nell McShane Wulfhart</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/north-america/united-states/pennsylvania/philadelphia/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Philadelphia Coverage</a></li>
</ul>

      <div id="g-story-yellowstone" class="g-story "
  data-slug="yellowstone">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-yellowstone_24"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/yellowstone-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">4.</span> Yellowstone National Park</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">The nation’s first national park offers new lodging.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p><a href="http://www.nps.gov/yell/index.htm">&#xAD;Yellowstone National Park</a> will get a major lodging upgrade with the $70 million redesign of the largest accommodation complex in the park,<a href="http://www.yellowstonenationalparklodges.com/lodging/summer-lodges/canyon-lodge-cabins/"> Canyon Lodge and Cabins,</a> with more than 500 rooms. Near the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone River, five new sustainably built lodges, three of which will open in spring, will replace outdated cabins, and new walking and biking paths will link the village with the park&#x2019;s North Rim Drive. If you&#x2019;re heading to the park this winter, before those open, you can explore the frosty, untrafficked landscape with the nonprofit<a href="https://www.yellowstoneassociation.org/"> Yellowstone Association,</a> which is offering two-day/three-night cross-country ski and wildlife-watching trips. And for the first time since 2003, park managers will allow self-guided snowmobile tours, by permit only. <span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Elaine Glusac</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The Clepsydra Geyser erupts at sunset in the Lower Geyser Basin.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Rachid Dahnoun
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="yellowstone" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/yellowstone-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=yellowstone" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Yellowstone National Park">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Yellowstone National Park is No. 4 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/yellowstone-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Yellowstone National Park" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>

    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">4.</span> Yellowstone National Park</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">The nation’s first national park offers new lodging.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p><a href="http://www.nps.gov/yell/index.htm">&#xAD;Yellowstone National Park</a> will get a major lodging upgrade with the $70 million redesign of the largest accommodation complex in the park,<a href="http://www.yellowstonenationalparklodges.com/lodging/summer-lodges/canyon-lodge-cabins/"> Canyon Lodge and Cabins,</a> with more than 500 rooms. Near the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone River, five new sustainably built lodges, three of which will open in spring, will replace outdated cabins, and new walking and biking paths will link the village with the park&#x2019;s North Rim Drive. If you&#x2019;re heading to the park this winter, before those open, you can explore the frosty, untrafficked landscape with the nonprofit<a href="https://www.yellowstoneassociation.org/"> Yellowstone Association,</a> which is offering two-day/three-night cross-country ski and wildlife-watching trips. And for the first time since 2003, park managers will allow self-guided snowmobile tours, by permit only. <span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Elaine Glusac</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-elquivalley" class="g-story g-hasVideo"
  data-slug="elquivalley">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-elquivalley_29"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/elquivalley-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">5.</span> Elqui Valley, Chile</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Stargaze — while you can — in Northern Chile.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;The deserts of northern Chile, whose dry, clear skies and high altitude make for unmatched stargazing, have long been home to some of the world&#x2019;s largest research telescopes. Those stunning starscapes, as well as more down-to-earth charms, have lately proved a draw for travelers, too. The heart of the astrotourism boom is the Elqui Valley, a 100-mile strip of vineyards and orchards on the southern edge of the Atacama Desert, dotted with colonial towns and pisco distilleries. At least a half-dozen<a href="http://s.bl-1.com/h/kY2jxmL"> small observatories</a> now cater to stargazers, while family-run hotels offer<a href="http://s.bl-1.com/h/kY2j18N"> special domed and glass-ceilinged suites</a> and in-room telescopes. But visit soon: Light pollution from new tourist infrastructure has already begun to dim Elqui&#x2019;s magnificent skies.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Remy Scalza</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The Gemini South telescope.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Gemini Observatory/AURA
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="elquivalley" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/elquivalley-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=elquivalley" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Elqui Valley, Chile">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Elqui Valley, Chile is No. 5 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/elquivalley-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Elqui Valley, Chile" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Elqui Valley, Chile: Stargaze — while you can — in Northern Chile. / #5 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/elquivalley-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Elqui Valley, Chile">

      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825443417512764">What did we miss in the Elqui Valley? Share your tips. </a>

    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">5.</span> Elqui Valley, Chile</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure

            <!-- laziestloader container -->
<div 
id="g-media-elquivalley_31"
data-ratio="0.66666667"
data-slug="elquivalley"
class="g-lazy-video g-lazy-media">
  <!-- vhs container -->
  <div id="g-media-elquivalley_31_vhs" class="g-vhs"></div>
</div>

            <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
                <span class="g-caption-text">The Gemini South telescope.</span>
                <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                    <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                    Gemini Observatory/AURA
                </span>
            </figcaption>
          </figure>
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Stargaze — while you can — in Northern Chile.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;The deserts of northern Chile, whose dry, clear skies and high altitude make for unmatched stargazing, have long been home to some of the world&#x2019;s largest research telescopes. Those stunning starscapes, as well as more down-to-earth charms, have lately proved a draw for travelers, too. The heart of the astrotourism boom is the Elqui Valley, a 100-mile strip of vineyards and orchards on the southern edge of the Atacama Desert, dotted with colonial towns and pisco distilleries. At least a half-dozen<a href="http://s.bl-1.com/h/kY2jxmL"> small observatories</a> now cater to stargazers, while family-run hotels offer<a href="http://s.bl-1.com/h/kY2j18N"> special domed and glass-ceilinged suites</a> and in-room telescopes. But visit soon: Light pollution from new tourist infrastructure has already begun to dim Elqui&#x2019;s magnificent skies.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Remy Scalza</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/central-and-south-america/chile/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Chile Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="elquivalley" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/elquivalley-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=elquivalley" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Elqui Valley, Chile">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Elqui Valley, Chile is No. 5 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/elquivalley-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Elqui Valley, Chile" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Elqui Valley, Chile: Stargaze — while you can — in Northern Chile. / #5 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/elquivalley-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>

      <div id="g-story-singapore" class="g-story "
  data-slug="singapore">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-singapore_34"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/singapore-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">6.</span> Singapore</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">It’s a year-long birthday party, and the world is invited.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;Singapore is turning 50 in 2015, and the ambitious little city-state is pulling out all the stops to celebrate. Festivities began on New Year&#x2019;s Eve with a huge fireworks display set to music over Marina Bay. That will be followed by the riotous <a href="http://chingay.org.sg/">Chingay Parade</a> in February, featuring thousands of colorfully dressed performers. In the fall, a five-mile historic public art trail called the Jubilee Walk will be inaugurated, and the <a href="http://nationalgallery.sg">National Gallery Singapore</a> opens in the grand former Supreme Court and City Hall buildings, where it will house one of the largest collections of Southeast Asian art in the world. The showcase event will be the National Day parade at the site where Singapore&#x2019;s independence was declared in 1965. <span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Justin Bergman</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Gardens by the Bay. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Carlos Spottorno/Panos Pictures
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="singapore" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/singapore-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=singapore" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Singapore">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Singapore is No. 6 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/singapore-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">It’s a year-long birthday party, and the world is invited.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;Singapore is turning 50 in 2015, and the ambitious little city-state is pulling out all the stops to celebrate. Festivities began on New Year&#x2019;s Eve with a huge fireworks display set to music over Marina Bay. That will be followed by the riotous <a href="http://chingay.org.sg/">Chingay Parade</a> in February, featuring thousands of colorfully dressed performers. In the fall, a five-mile historic public art trail called the Jubilee Walk will be inaugurated, and the <a href="http://nationalgallery.sg">National Gallery Singapore</a> opens in the grand former Supreme Court and City Hall buildings, where it will house one of the largest collections of Southeast Asian art in the world. The showcase event will be the National Day parade at the site where Singapore&#x2019;s independence was declared in 1965. <span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Justin Bergman</span></p>
