      <div id="g-story-peru" class="g-story "
  data-slug="peru">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-peru_94"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/peru-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">18.</span> The North Coast of Peru</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A desert coast begs to be explored.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;As tourism in Peru expands beyond the obligatory trip to Cuzco, this often-overlooked desert region is opening up. <a href="http://www.peruthisweek.com/news-peru-stops-included-in-lindblads-new-cruise-itinerary-103947"> Lindblad Cruises</a> has added stops in Trujillo, near important archaeological sites like the adobe city of Chan Chan and the Moche pyramid complexes of Sip&#xE1;n and El Brujo, which have opened museums in recent years. In town, the<a href="http://www.libertador.com.pe/libertador/trujillo/informacion-general/"> Libertador hotel</a>, set in a Spanish colonial mansion, has undergone a $2 million renovation. Farther north, the<a href="http://www.chaparri.org/"> Chaparr&#xED; Reserve </a> outside of Chiclayo, a habitat for highly threatened Andean spectacle bears, will have a bit of pop-cultural relevance this year with the release of a Paddington Bear film, built around a member of the species &quot;from deepest, darkest Peru.&quot; If you&#x2019;d prefer nature by day and boutique digs by night, the eco-hotelier Inkaterra is following up the opening of <a href="http://www.kichic.com/"> the six-room KiCHIC</a>, in the low-key surf village of Mancora, by laying the groundwork for community-based tourism projects like sport-fishing and whale-watching charters at nearby Cabo Blanco, a former Hemingway fishing hangout, while pushing to establish a marine reserve and eventually a hotel.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Nicholas Gill</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The beachside town of Huanchaco.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Meridith Kohut for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="peru" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/peru-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=peru" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: The North Coast of Peru">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? The North Coast of Peru is No. 18 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/peru-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: The North Coast of Peru" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="The North Coast of Peru: A desert coast begs to be explored. / #18 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/peru-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: The North Coast of Peru">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825421234181649">Do you know the North Coast of Peru? Tell us what to see.</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825421234181649">On Facebook, a reader said:  “The fortress of Kuelap or Cuélap. A great hike up to the top and an amazing thick walled fortress that was apparently never conquered.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">18.</span> The North Coast of Peru</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/peru-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/peru-900.jpg" alt="Photo of The North Coast of Peru">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-peru_93"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/peru-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"
>
          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">The beachside town of Huanchaco.</span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                  <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                  Meridith Kohut for The New York Times
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A desert coast begs to be explored.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;As tourism in Peru expands beyond the obligatory trip to Cuzco, this often-overlooked desert region is opening up. <a href="http://www.peruthisweek.com/news-peru-stops-included-in-lindblads-new-cruise-itinerary-103947"> Lindblad Cruises</a> has added stops in Trujillo, near important archaeological sites like the adobe city of Chan Chan and the Moche pyramid complexes of Sip&#xE1;n and El Brujo, which have opened museums in recent years. In town, the<a href="http://www.libertador.com.pe/libertador/trujillo/informacion-general/"> Libertador hotel</a>, set in a Spanish colonial mansion, has undergone a $2 million renovation. Farther north, the<a href="http://www.chaparri.org/"> Chaparr&#xED; Reserve </a> outside of Chiclayo, a habitat for highly threatened Andean spectacle bears, will have a bit of pop-cultural relevance this year with the release of a Paddington Bear film, built around a member of the species &quot;from deepest, darkest Peru.&quot; If you&#x2019;d prefer nature by day and boutique digs by night, the eco-hotelier Inkaterra is following up the opening of <a href="http://www.kichic.com/"> the six-room KiCHIC</a>, in the low-key surf village of Mancora, by laying the groundwork for community-based tourism projects like sport-fishing and whale-watching charters at nearby Cabo Blanco, a former Hemingway fishing hangout, while pushing to establish a marine reserve and eventually a hotel.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Nicholas Gill</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/central-and-south-america/peru/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Peru Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="peru" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/peru-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=peru" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: The North Coast of Peru">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? The North Coast of Peru is No. 18 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/peru-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: The North Coast of Peru" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

      <div id="g-story-steamboatsprings" class="g-story g-hasVideo"
  data-slug="steamboatsprings">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-steamboatsprings_99"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/steamboatsprings-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">19.</span> Steamboat Springs, Colorado</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Celebrating a century of skiing.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>This winter marks the 100th anniversary of Colorado&#x2019;s oldest continually operating ski area. In late 1914, a Norwegian bricklayer named Carl Howelsen cleared trees and brush from a steep hillside overlooking Steamboat Springs to build what would eventually become Howelsen Hill Ski Area. These days, with its one double chair, three surface lifts and 440 vertical feet of skiing, Howelsen Hill is overshadowed by the ranching and mining town&#x2019;s bigger resort, Steamboat, which has 16 lifts, a 3,668-vertical-foot drop and recently expanded night skiing and new summer biking trails. But don&#x2019;t let size matter: Howelsen has produced at least 88 Olympians over the years. Head to Steamboat Springs in February for the<a href="http://www.steamboat-chamber.com/signature-events/winter-carnival"> Winter Carnival</a> to celebrate a century of skiing in the West with jumping exhibitions, tubing parties and parades.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Tim Neville</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Strawberry Park Hot Springs.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Morgan Rachel Levy for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="steamboatsprings" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/steamboatsprings-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=steamboatsprings" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Steamboat Springs, Colorado">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Steamboat Springs, Colorado is No. 19 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/steamboatsprings-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Steamboat Springs, Colorado" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Steamboat Springs, Colorado: Celebrating a century of skiing. / #19 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/steamboatsprings-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

  <div class="g-facebookthread">

      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825421790848260">Know the slopes of Steamboat Springs? Share your tips.</a> 
    </h4>

    <div class="g-media-container">

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Celebrating a century of skiing.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>This winter marks the 100th anniversary of Colorado&#x2019;s oldest continually operating ski area. In late 1914, a Norwegian bricklayer named Carl Howelsen cleared trees and brush from a steep hillside overlooking Steamboat Springs to build what would eventually become Howelsen Hill Ski Area. These days, with its one double chair, three surface lifts and 440 vertical feet of skiing, Howelsen Hill is overshadowed by the ranching and mining town&#x2019;s bigger resort, Steamboat, which has 16 lifts, a 3,668-vertical-foot drop and recently expanded night skiing and new summer biking trails. But don&#x2019;t let size matter: Howelsen has produced at least 88 Olympians over the years. Head to Steamboat Springs in February for the<a href="http://www.steamboat-chamber.com/signature-events/winter-carnival"> Winter Carnival</a> to celebrate a century of skiing in the West with jumping exhibitions, tubing parties and parades.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Tim Neville</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-oman" class="g-story "
  data-slug="oman">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-oman_104"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/oman-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">20.</span> Oman</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">The Middle East’s best-kept secret no longer.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;The sultanate of Oman shares little with the United Arab Emirates aside from a border: The staggering peaks in Oman&#x2019;s landscapes come from mountains not skyscrapers; its dramatic coastlines owe little to man-made engineering; and the unending hubbub of Dubai and Abu Dhabi is contrasted here with the sheer silence of Oman&#x2019;s numerous wadis, or ravines. But don&#x2019;t expect this idyll to remain unspoiled for long. Oman has lately been in the throes of a hotel boom of Dubai-like proportions: <a href="http://www.alilahotels.com/jabalakhdar/">Alila Jabal Akhdar</a> opened against a staggering mountainscape last year; next up, <a href="http://www.anantara.com/">Anantara</a> is planning two resorts &#x2014; a rival for Alila in Jabal Akhdar and another along the Dhofar coast in the south &#x2014; and <a href="http://www.radissonblu.com/hotel-sohar">Radisson Blu</a> moves in to Sohar, a historic port in the country&#x2019;s northern reaches. Four Seasons, W, Kempinski, Fairmont and Aman are said to be planning forays.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Sarah Khan</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Irrigation canals in the town Birkat al Mawz.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Christian Bobst/13 Photo, via Redux
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="oman" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/oman-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=oman" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Oman">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Oman is No. 20 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/oman-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Oman" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Oman: The Middle East’s best-kept secret no longer. / #20 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/oman-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Oman">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825422074181565">What did we miss in Oman? Share your tips. </a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825422074181565">On Facebook, a reader said:  “The Musandam Peninsula is breathtaking known for its fjords and rugged beauty.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">20.</span> Oman</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/oman-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/oman-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Oman">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-oman_103"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/oman-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"
>
          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">Irrigation canals in the town Birkat al Mawz.</span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                  <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                  Christian Bobst/13 Photo, via Redux
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">The Middle East’s best-kept secret no longer.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;The sultanate of Oman shares little with the United Arab Emirates aside from a border: The staggering peaks in Oman&#x2019;s landscapes come from mountains not skyscrapers; its dramatic coastlines owe little to man-made engineering; and the unending hubbub of Dubai and Abu Dhabi is contrasted here with the sheer silence of Oman&#x2019;s numerous wadis, or ravines. But don&#x2019;t expect this idyll to remain unspoiled for long. Oman has lately been in the throes of a hotel boom of Dubai-like proportions: <a href="http://www.alilahotels.com/jabalakhdar/">Alila Jabal Akhdar</a> opened against a staggering mountainscape last year; next up, <a href="http://www.anantara.com/">Anantara</a> is planning two resorts &#x2014; a rival for Alila in Jabal Akhdar and another along the Dhofar coast in the south &#x2014; and <a href="http://www.radissonblu.com/hotel-sohar">Radisson Blu</a> moves in to Sohar, a historic port in the country&#x2019;s northern reaches. Four Seasons, W, Kempinski, Fairmont and Aman are said to be planning forays.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Sarah Khan</span></p>
        

        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="oman" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/oman-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=oman" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Oman">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Oman is No. 20 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/oman-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Oman" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Oman: The Middle East’s best-kept secret no longer. / #20 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/oman-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Oman">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>

    </li>
  </ul>



      </div>

      <div id="g-story-cleveland" class="g-story "
  data-slug="cleveland">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-cleveland_109"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/cleveland-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">21.</span> Cleveland, Ohio</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A comeback fueled by art, culture and King James.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;When LeBron James decided to return to his roots, Cleveland was already rallying after decades of decline. A milelong stretch of Detroit Avenue is now the<a href="http://gordonsquare.org"> Gordon Square Arts District</a>, the city&#x2019;s newest creative hub. Waterfront warehouses are being transformed into restaurants and retail spaces. And the recent reopening of the<a href="http://mocacleveland.org"> Museum of Contemporary Art</a> in a modern mirrored, hexagonal structure has solidified the<a href="http://uptowncleveland.com"> Uptown district</a>&#x2019;s newly hip status. Another reason to visit this year? To beat the politicos who will descend on the city for the 2016 Republican National Convention.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Ingrid K. Williams</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Museum of Contemporary Art Cleveland.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Dustin Franz
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="cleveland" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/cleveland-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=cleveland" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Cleveland, Ohio">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Cleveland, Ohio is No. 21 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/cleveland-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A comeback fueled by art, culture and King James.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;When LeBron James decided to return to his roots, Cleveland was already rallying after decades of decline. A milelong stretch of Detroit Avenue is now the<a href="http://gordonsquare.org"> Gordon Square Arts District</a>, the city&#x2019;s newest creative hub. Waterfront warehouses are being transformed into restaurants and retail spaces. And the recent reopening of the<a href="http://mocacleveland.org"> Museum of Contemporary Art</a> in a modern mirrored, hexagonal structure has solidified the<a href="http://uptowncleveland.com"> Uptown district</a>&#x2019;s newly hip status. To beat the politicos who will descend on the city for the 2016 Republican National Convention.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Ingrid K. Williams</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-srilanka" class="g-story "
  data-slug="srilanka">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-srilanka_114"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/srilanka-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">22.</span> Sri Lanka</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">More stability means better access to more treasures.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>While tourism on this South Asian island was growing in fits and starts for almost a decade, visits to the region were hampered by unrest. Lately, however, the country seems genuinely stable, and a new generation of hotels is offering luxurious and creative accommodations. The 40-room<a href="http://capeweligama.com"> Cape Weligama</a> opened on a 12-acre site overlooking the Indian Ocean. This spring,<a href="http://trilanka.com"> TRI</a>, a new 10-suite hotel will also offer a boutique option on the banks of Lake Koggala, with a cantilevered pool and treetop yoga studio; in November, the Wild Coast Lodge will make its debut on a beautiful beach in<a href="http://www.yalasrilanka.lk/"> Yala National Park</a>, with 28 luxury tents and an Ayurvedic spa. Infrastructure is also improving. Exhibit A is a coastal highway that has made the journey between Galle and Colombo a snap.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Ondine Cohane</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: A peacock in Yala National Park.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Kevin Schafer/Corbis
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="srilanka" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/srilanka-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=srilanka" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Sri Lanka">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Sri Lanka is No. 22 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/srilanka-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Sri Lanka" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Sri Lanka: More stability means better access to more treasures. / #22 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/srilanka-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Sri Lanka">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>

  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">22.</span> Sri Lanka</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/srilanka-900.jpg"

          </figcaption>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">More stability means better access to more treasures.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>While tourism on this South Asian island was growing in fits and starts for almost a decade, visits to the region were hampered by unrest. Lately, however, the country seems genuinely stable, and a new generation of hotels is offering luxurious and creative accommodations. The 40-room<a href="http://capeweligama.com"> Cape Weligama</a> opened on a 12-acre site overlooking the Indian Ocean. This spring,<a href="http://trilanka.com"> TRI</a>, a new 10-suite hotel will also offer a boutique option on the banks of Lake Koggala, with a cantilevered pool and treetop yoga studio; in November, the Wild Coast Lodge will make its debut on a beautiful beach in<a href="http://www.yalasrilanka.lk/"> Yala National Park</a>, with 28 luxury tents and an Ayurvedic spa. Infrastructure is also improving. Exhibit A is a coastal highway that has made the journey between Galle and Colombo a snap.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Ondine Cohane</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/asia/sri-lanka/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Sri Lanka Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="srilanka" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/srilanka-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=srilanka" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Sri Lanka">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Sri Lanka is No. 22 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/srilanka-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Sri Lanka" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Sri Lanka: More stability means better access to more treasures. / #22 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/srilanka-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Sri Lanka">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      </div>
      <div class="g-tools">
        <div class="g-map"><img

></div>
      </div> <!-- .g-tools -->
    </div> <!-- .g-content-container -->


    
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825422534181519">What did we miss in Sri Lanka? Share your tips.</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825422534181519">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Sinharaja rain forest for sheer biodiversity.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>

      <div id="g-story-neworleans" class="g-story g-hasVideo"
  data-slug="neworleans">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-neworleans_119"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/neworleans-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">23.</span> New Orleans, Louisiana</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Resilient and renewed, a decade after Katrina.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>This year, the 10th anniversary of the catastrophic hurricane, the city will showcase just how far it has come, with events planned to commemorate the victims, and unveilings to highlight its rebirth. Through Jan. 25,<a href="http://prospectneworleans.org"> Prospect.3 New Orleans</a>, puts the spotlight on the burgeoning arts scene here in an exhibition of works by more than 50 contemporary artists. In March, the<a href="http://thenojo.com"> New Orleans Jazz Orchestra</a> opens in a new home that has a state-of-the-art performance space, as well as exhibits of current and former jazz greats. And the new development of the South Market District will be home to a diverse set of businesses, including the highly anticipated restaurant Ursa Major and the furniture store<a href="http://arhaus.com"> Arhaus</a>. Further signs of the city&#x2019;s recovery are evident in new lodging, like the just opened<a href="http://www.lemeridienneworleanshotel.com/"> Le Meridien</a> and<a href="http://www.starwoodhotels.com/alofthotels/property/overview/index.html?propertyID=4022&amp;language=en_US"> Aloft New Orleans Downtown</a>, to open in New Orleans&#x2019;s Central Business district in late February.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Ondine Cohane</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Crescent Park in the Bywater area.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              William Widmer for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="neworleans" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/neworleans-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=neworleans" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: New Orleans, Louisiana">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? New Orleans, Louisiana is No. 23 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/neworleans-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: New Orleans, Louisiana" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>

    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: New Orleans, Louisiana">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>

    </li>
  </ul>

  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">23.</span> New Orleans, Louisiana</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Resilient and renewed, a decade after Katrina.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>This year, the 10th anniversary of the catastrophic hurricane, the city will showcase just how far it has come, with events planned to commemorate the victims, and unveilings to highlight its rebirth. Through Jan. 25,<a href="http://prospectneworleans.org"> Prospect.3 New Orleans</a>, puts the spotlight on the burgeoning arts scene here in an exhibition of works by more than 50 contemporary artists. In March, the<a href="http://thenojo.com"> New Orleans Jazz Orchestra</a> opens in a new home that has a state-of-the-art performance space, as well as exhibits of current and former jazz greats. And the new development of the South Market District will be home to a diverse set of businesses, including the highly anticipated restaurant Ursa Major and the furniture store<a href="http://arhaus.com"> Arhaus</a>. Further signs of the city&#x2019;s recovery are evident in new lodging, like the just opened<a href="http://www.lemeridienneworleanshotel.com/"> Le Meridien</a> and<a href="http://www.starwoodhotels.com/alofthotels/property/overview/index.html?propertyID=4022&amp;language=en_US"> Aloft New Orleans Downtown</a>, to open in New Orleans&#x2019;s Central Business district in late February.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Ondine Cohane</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-adelaide" class="g-story "
  data-slug="adelaide">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-adelaide_124"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/adelaide-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">24.</span> Adelaide, Australia</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">On the southern coast, art, food and more.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Sure, Adelaide, the capital of South Australia, is close to both wine country and beaches. But there are more reasons to stay in the city, thanks largely to an energetic arts scene &#x2014; anchored this year by festivals like the<a href="http://www.adelaidefestival.com.au/"> Adelaide Festival</a>,<a href="http://www.womadelaide.com.au/"> WOMADelaide</a>,<a href="http://www.salainc.com.au/"> SALA</a> and the biennial<a href="http://adelaidefilmfestival.org/"> Adelaide Film Festival</a> &#x2014; and robust dining scene that encompasses everything from street (<a href="http://forkontheroad.com.au/">Fork on the Road</a>) to posh (<a href="http://www.adelaideoval.com.au/4146/hill-of-grace-restaurant.aspx">Hill of Grace</a>, atop the redeveloped<a href="http://www.adelaideoval.com.au/138/venue.aspx"> Adelaide Oval</a>). Stellar local ingredients can be found at<a href="http://organicsustainablemarket.com.au/"> South Australia&#x2019;s first organic and sustainable market</a> and so can inspired menus (<a href="http://www.seanskitchen.com.au/">Sean&#x2019;s Kitchen</a>), while cool bars (<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Maybe-Mae/476220975850155">Maybe Mae</a>) and cafes (<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/La-Moka/1443551049232132">La Moka</a>) dot a renewed West End precinct. Adding to the city&#x2019;s vitality are<a href="http://www.unisa.edu.au/artafterdark"> Art After Dark</a> and<a href="http://www.artgallery.sa.gov.au/agsa/home/Events/First_Fridays.html"> First Fridays</a>: live music, speakers, exhibitions and screenings during extended hours at<a href="http://www.unisa.edu.au/Business-community/Samstag-Museum/"> Samstag Museum</a>, the design-centric<a href="http://www.jamfactory.com.au/"> JamFactory</a>,<a href="http://www.artgallery.sa.gov.au/agsa/home"> Art Gallery of South Australia</a> and galleries. The cultured atmosphere extends to lodging: In February<a href="http://www.artserieshotels.com.au/watson/"> The Watson</a> becomes Adelaide&#x2019;s newest art hotel.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Robyn Eckhardt</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The waterfront area of Adelaide, on the River Torrens.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Ben Goode/Alamy
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="adelaide" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/adelaide-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=adelaide" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Adelaide, Australia">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Adelaide, Australia is No. 24 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/adelaide-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Adelaide, Australia" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Adelaide, Australia: On the southern coast, art, food and more. / #24 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/adelaide-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Adelaide, Australia">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825445827512523">Do you know Adelaide? Tell us what to see.
</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825445827512523">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Don't skip McLaren Vale - Lots of good wineries up there“ <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">24.</span> Adelaide, Australia</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/adelaide-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/adelaide-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Adelaide, Australia">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-adelaide_123"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/adelaide-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"
>
          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">The waterfront area of Adelaide, on the River Torrens.</span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                  <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                  Ben Goode/Alamy
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">On the southern coast, art, food and more.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Sure, Adelaide, the capital of South Australia, is close to both wine country and beaches. But there are more reasons to stay in the city, thanks largely to an energetic arts scene &#x2014; anchored this year by festivals like the<a href="http://www.adelaidefestival.com.au/"> Adelaide Festival</a>,<a href="http://www.womadelaide.com.au/"> WOMADelaide</a>,<a href="http://www.salainc.com.au/"> SALA</a> and the biennial<a href="http://adelaidefilmfestival.org/"> Adelaide Film Festival</a> &#x2014; and robust dining scene that encompasses everything from street (<a href="http://forkontheroad.com.au/">Fork on the Road</a>) to posh (<a href="http://www.adelaideoval.com.au/4146/hill-of-grace-restaurant.aspx">Hill of Grace</a>, atop the redeveloped<a href="http://www.adelaideoval.com.au/138/venue.aspx"> Adelaide Oval</a>). Stellar local ingredients can be found at<a href="http://organicsustainablemarket.com.au/"> South Australia&#x2019;s first organic and sustainable market</a> and so can inspired menus (<a href="http://www.seanskitchen.com.au/">Sean&#x2019;s Kitchen</a>), while cool bars (<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Maybe-Mae/476220975850155">Maybe Mae</a>) and cafes (<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/La-Moka/1443551049232132">La Moka</a>) dot a renewed West End precinct. Adding to the city&#x2019;s vitality are<a href="http://www.unisa.edu.au/artafterdark"> Art After Dark</a> and<a href="http://www.artgallery.sa.gov.au/agsa/home/Events/First_Fridays.html"> First Fridays</a>: live music, speakers, exhibitions and screenings during extended hours at<a href="http://www.unisa.edu.au/Business-community/Samstag-Museum/"> Samstag Museum</a>, the design-centric<a href="http://www.jamfactory.com.au/"> JamFactory</a>,<a href="http://www.artgallery.sa.gov.au/agsa/home"> Art Gallery of South Australia</a> and galleries. The cultured atmosphere extends to lodging: In February<a href="http://www.artserieshotels.com.au/watson/"> The Watson</a> becomes Adelaide&#x2019;s newest art hotel.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Robyn Eckhardt</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/australia-and-pacific/australia/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Australia Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="adelaide" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/adelaide-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=adelaide" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Adelaide, Australia">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Adelaide, Australia is No. 24 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/adelaide-900.jpg">

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

      <div id="g-story-georgia" class="g-story "
  data-slug="georgia">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-georgia_129"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/georgia-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">25.</span> Georgia</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A wine revival at the foot of the Caucasus.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Georgia has all the makings of the next great wine destination: the world&#x2019;s longest-running unbroken wine tradition (underground fermentation in clay vessels), hundreds of indigenous grape varieties, stunning landscapes and a band of vintners espousing natural methods. Its output has all become easier to sample, too, thanks to wine bars in the capital, Tbilisi (<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Konka/796744473671469?sk=info">Konka</a>,<a href="http://www.vinounderground.ge/"> Vino Underground</a>), a marked wine trail in Kakheti and wineries (<a href="http://www.pheasantstears.com/">Pheasant&#x2019;s Tears</a>,<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Iagos-Wine%E1%83%98%E1%83%90%E1%83%92%E1%83%9D%E1%83%A1-%E1%83%A6%E1%83%95%E1%83%98%E1%83%9C%E1%83%9D/174446485942614?fref=nf"> Iago&#x2019;s Winery</a>,<a href="http://www.gwa.ge/?7/285/"> Winery Khareba</a>) serving traditional and modern Georgian cuisine. Those varietals will be feted this year at four major events: the New Wine Festival, Wine City Tbilisi at Tbilisifest, Telavino and the Tbilisi Cheese Festival. <a href="http://tastegeorgia.co">TasteGeorgia</a>, a new local venture, can arrange food and wine tours, private meals with winemakers and tastings in Kakheti and beyond.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Robyn Eckhardt</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: A shopowner sells dried fruits and nuts at the Dezertiri Market in Tbilisi, Georgia. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              David Hagerman
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="georgia" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/georgia-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=georgia" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Georgia">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Georgia is No. 25 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/georgia-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Georgia" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Georgia: A wine revival at the foot of the Caucasus. / #25 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/georgia-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Georgia">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825448160845623">What did we miss in Georgia? Share your tips.</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825448160845623">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Batumi is an up and coming resort town on the Black Sea and Svaneti is a great little village up in the mountains with some nice hiking in the vicinity.”  <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">25.</span> Georgia</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/georgia-900.jpg"

          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A wine revival at the foot of the Caucasus.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Georgia has all the makings of the next great wine destination: the world&#x2019;s longest-running unbroken wine tradition (underground fermentation in clay vessels), hundreds of indigenous grape varieties, stunning landscapes and a band of vintners espousing natural methods. Its output has all become easier to sample, too, thanks to wine bars in the capital, Tbilisi (<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Konka/796744473671469?sk=info">Konka</a>,<a href="http://www.vinounderground.ge/"> Vino Underground</a>), a marked wine trail in Kakheti and wineries (<a href="http://www.pheasantstears.com/">Pheasant&#x2019;s Tears</a>,<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Iagos-Wine%E1%83%98%E1%83%90%E1%83%92%E1%83%9D%E1%83%A1-%E1%83%A6%E1%83%95%E1%83%98%E1%83%9C%E1%83%9D/174446485942614?fref=nf"> Iago&#x2019;s Winery</a>,<a href="http://www.gwa.ge/?7/285/"> Winery Khareba</a>) serving traditional and modern Georgian cuisine.       <div id="g-story-manchester" class="g-story g-hasVideo"
  data-slug="manchester">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-manchester_134"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/manchester-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">26.</span> Manchester, England</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A former industrial hub shows off its sophisticated side.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>A flurry of cultural openings fills the 2015 calendar of this now edgy city, beginning with<a href="http://www.whitworth.manchester.ac.uk/"> the completion of the Whitworth</a>, a &#x20A4;15-million renovation and expansion of the former Whitworth Art Gallery into its adjoining park with an art garden and sculpture terraces in February. In the spring, the &#x20A4;25 million<a href="http://homemcr.org/"> HOME</a>, a film center and theater, will open. Last fall, the Regency-style former home of the 19th-century writer<a href="http://www.elizabethgaskellhouse.co.uk/"> Elizabeth Gaskell</a>, known to her publisher, Charles Dickens, as &quot;Scheherazade,&quot; opened as a visitor attraction. But it&#x2019;s not all high culture. This soccer stronghold will be home to <a href="http://www.hotelfootball.com/"> Hotel Football</a>, opening in March next to the Old Trafford stadium. The hotel, backed by five former Manchester United players, is one of four new boutiques in the pipeline.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Elaine Glusac</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Castlefield Urban Heritage Park.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Luke Wolagiewicz for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="manchester" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/manchester-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=manchester" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Manchester, England">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Manchester, England is No. 26 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/manchester-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Manchester, England" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Manchester, England: A former industrial hub shows off its sophisticated side. / #26 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/manchester-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Manchester, England">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825398754183897">Do you know Manchester? Tell us what to see.</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825398754183897">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Don't miss John Rylands Library and Cheetham's, the oldest public library in England!“ <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">26.</span> Manchester, England</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A former industrial hub shows off its sophisticated side.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>A flurry of cultural openings fills the 2015 calendar of this now edgy city, beginning with<a href="http://www.whitworth.manchester.ac.uk/"> the completion of the Whitworth</a>, a &#x20A4;15-million renovation and expansion of the former Whitworth Art Gallery into its adjoining park with an art garden and sculpture terraces in February. Last fall, the Regency-style former home of the 19th-century writer<a href="http://www.elizabethgaskellhouse.co.uk/"> Elizabeth Gaskell</a>, known to her publisher, Charles Dickens, as &quot;Scheherazade,&quot; opened as a visitor attraction.   <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/europe/britain/england/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent England Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="manchester" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/manchester-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=manchester" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Manchester, England">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Manchester, England is No. 26 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/manchester-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Manchester, England" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Manchester, England: A former industrial hub shows off its sophisticated side. / #26 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/manchester-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Manchester, England">

      <div id="g-story-campeche" class="g-story "
  data-slug="campeche">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-campeche_139"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/campeche-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">27.</span> Campeche, Mexico</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A less-touristed ancient Maya city.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;Deep in the Yucatan peninsula&#x2019;s jungle-shrouded interior, in the heart of a protected biosphere reserve, lie the extensive but little-known ruins of Calakmul, which in its seventh-century prime was one of the most powerful cities in the Maya world. Last year Unesco recognized 1,280 square miles of the tropical forest surrounding it as a <a href="http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/1061">World Heritage site</a>, making the ruins and jungle together Mexico&#x2019;s first &quot;mixed&quot; property on the World Heritage List, recognized for both natural and cultural value. Morning visitors to the 10-plus-square-mile site, where pyramids rise above a forest canopy populated by monkeys and toucans, can experience a solitude unthinkable at tourist-clogged Maya sites like Chich&#xE9;n Itz&#xE1;.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Elisabeth Eaves</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The ruins of Calakmul. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Joe Ray
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="campeche" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/campeche-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=campeche" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Campeche, Mexico">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Campeche, Mexico is No. 27 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/campeche-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Campeche, Mexico" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Campeche, Mexico: A less-touristed ancient Maya city. / #27 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/campeche-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Campeche, Mexico">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825402407516865">What are your favorite things to do in Campeche?</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825402407516865">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Just returned from Calakmul. With monkeys, giant pyramids, and solitude, it was easily a highlight of our two weeks in the Yucatan.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">27.</span> Campeche, Mexico</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/campeche-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/campeche-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Campeche, Mexico">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-campeche_138"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"

data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"

          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">The ruins of Calakmul. </span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                  <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                  Joe Ray
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A less-touristed ancient Maya city.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;Deep in the Yucatan peninsula&#x2019;s jungle-shrouded interior, in the heart of a protected biosphere reserve, lie the extensive but little-known ruins of Calakmul, which in its seventh-century prime was one of the most powerful cities in the Maya world. Last year Unesco recognized 1,280 square miles of the tropical forest surrounding it as a <a href="http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/1061">World Heritage site</a>, making the ruins and jungle together Mexico&#x2019;s first &quot;mixed&quot; property on the World Heritage List, recognized for both natural and cultural value. Morning visitors to the 10-plus-square-mile site, where pyramids rise above a forest canopy populated by monkeys and toucans, can experience a solitude unthinkable at tourist-clogged Maya sites like Chich&#xE9;n Itz&#xE1;.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Elisabeth Eaves</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/north-america/mexico/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Mexico Coverage</a></li>
</ul>

      <div id="g-story-greenland" class="g-story "
  data-slug="greenland">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-greenland_144"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/greenland-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">28.</span> Greenland</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Greener than you’d think.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;Visitors to Greenland often go for whale-, iceberg- and glacier-watching tours, but active overland travel (beyond dog-sledding) is now becoming more enticing. Working farms sit among the fjords of southern Greenland, where a changing climate and a longer growing season have fueled interest in the new Greenlandic cuisine. Hikers can walk along trails between farms near Qaqortoq and Narsarsuaq for rustic beds and unusual farm-to-table meals like whale skin with angelica herb, garlic and rosemary pickles. One farm, the<a href="http://www.ipiutaq.com/reception.html"> Ipiutaq Guest House</a>, recently won Greenland&#x2019;s first concession for exclusive access to a world-class arctic char fishery. Land a fish and the French chef Agathe Devisme will prepare it with wild herbs collected from the property.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Tim Neville</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: In Qassiarsuk, a village near Narsarsuaq.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Yadid Levy/Anzenberger, via Redux
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="greenland" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/greenland-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=greenland" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Greenland">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Greenland is No. 28 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/greenland-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Greenland" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Greenland: Greener than you’d think. / #28 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/greenland-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Greenland">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825399527517153">What did we miss in Greenland? Share your tips.</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825399527517153">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Unforgettable: slowly cruising the Ilulissat icefjord at midnight (still sunny!) on an old red boat.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>

    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">28.</span> Greenland</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Greener than you’d think.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;Visitors to Greenland often go for whale-, iceberg- and glacier-watching tours, but active overland travel (beyond dog-sledding) is now becoming more enticing. Working farms sit among the fjords of southern Greenland, where a changing climate and a longer growing season have fueled interest in the new Greenlandic cuisine. Hikers can walk along trails between farms near Qaqortoq and Narsarsuaq for rustic beds and unusual farm-to-table meals like whale skin with angelica herb, garlic and rosemary pickles. One farm, the<a href="http://www.ipiutaq.com/reception.html"> Ipiutaq Guest House</a>, recently won Greenland&#x2019;s first concession for exclusive access to a world-class arctic char fishery. Land a fish and the French chef Agathe Devisme will prepare it with wild herbs collected from the property.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Tim Neville</span></p>
