      <div id="g-story-zermatt" class="g-story "
  data-slug="zermatt">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-zermatt_209"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/zermatt-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">41.</span> Canton Valais, Switzerland</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Celebrating two milestone birthdays with bonfires and wine.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Switzerland&#x2019;s bilingual Canton Valais &#x2014; home to the ski destination Zermatt and the iconic Matterhorn &#x2014; is celebrating two milestones: the <a href="http://www.zermatt.ch/en/150">150th anniversary of Edward Whymper&#x2019;s ascent of the Matterhorn</a> and the canton&#x2019;s 200th birthday. To mark the occasions, officials are throwing a canton-wide fete that includes a<a href="http://www.valais.ch/en/events/valais-2015-programme/13-stars-on-the-summit"> bonfire light show atop 26 different summits; </a><a href="http://www.zermatt.ch/en/150/Activities-Offers-for-2015/Zermatt-s-first-open-air-theatre"> open air theatrical performances</a>; an eco-friendly refurbishment of the 19th-century<a href="http://www.hoernlihuette.ch/hoernlihuette_18.html"> H&#xF6;rnlih&#xFC;tte</a>, a rustic guesthouse; and<a href="http://www.cube365.ch"> the opening of Cube 365</a>, a plush single-bed hotel cube that will move to 52 sites throughout the year. There&#x2019;s also a new<a href="http://www.pfyn-finges.ch/en/discover-and-experience/discovering-the-park-alone/museums-and-exhibitions/wine-sensorium-in-salgesch"> wine museum in Salgesch</a>, which opened in 2014 and showcases the region&#x2019;s unusual varietals, like petite arvine and humagne rouge. Say pr&#xF6;stli or sant&#xE9; (depending on whom you&#x2019;re drinking with) and enjoy a glass.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Adam H. Graham</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Vineyards in Canton Valais.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Jean Revillard
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="zermatt" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/zermatt-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=zermatt" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Canton Valais, Switzerland">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Canton Valais, Switzerland is No. 41 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/zermatt-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Canton Valais, Switzerland" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Canton Valais, Switzerland: Celebrating two milestone birthdays with bonfires and wine. / #41 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/zermatt-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Canton Valais, Switzerland">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825407170849722">What are your favorite things to do in Canton Valais?
</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825407170849722">On Facebook, a reader said:  “The Valais is my favorite region in Switzerland and the best time of the year is the colorful autumn.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">41.</span> Canton Valais, Switzerland</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/zermatt-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>

          <img 
id="g-media-zermatt_208"

                  Jean Revillard
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Celebrating two milestone birthdays with bonfires and wine.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Switzerland&#x2019;s bilingual Canton Valais &#x2014; home to the ski destination Zermatt and the iconic Matterhorn &#x2014; is celebrating two milestones: the <a href="http://www.zermatt.ch/en/150">150th anniversary of Edward Whymper&#x2019;s ascent of the Matterhorn</a> and the canton&#x2019;s 200th birthday. To mark the occasions, officials are throwing a canton-wide fete that includes a<a href="http://www.valais.ch/en/events/valais-2015-programme/13-stars-on-the-summit"> bonfire light show atop 26 different summits; </a><a href="http://www.zermatt.ch/en/150/Activities-Offers-for-2015/Zermatt-s-first-open-air-theatre"> open air theatrical performances</a>; an eco-friendly refurbishment of the 19th-century<a href="http://www.hoernlihuette.ch/hoernlihuette_18.html"> H&#xF6;rnlih&#xFC;tte</a>, a rustic guesthouse; and<a href="http://www.cube365.ch"> the opening of Cube 365</a>, a plush single-bed hotel cube that will move to 52 sites throughout the year. There&#x2019;s also a new<a href="http://www.pfyn-finges.ch/en/discover-and-experience/discovering-the-park-alone/museums-and-exhibitions/wine-sensorium-in-salgesch"> wine museum in Salgesch</a>, which opened in 2014 and showcases the region&#x2019;s unusual varietals, like petite arvine and humagne rouge. Say pr&#xF6;stli or sant&#xE9; (depending on whom you&#x2019;re drinking with) and enjoy a glass.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Adam H. Graham</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/europe/switzerland/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Switzerland Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="zermatt" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/zermatt-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=zermatt" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Canton Valais, Switzerland">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Canton Valais, Switzerland is No. 41 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/zermatt-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Canton Valais, Switzerland: Celebrating two milestone birthdays with bonfires and wine. / #41 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/zermatt-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>

      <div id="g-story-paris" class="g-story "
  data-slug="paris">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-paris_214"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/paris-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">42.</span> Île-de-France</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Beyond the Périphérique of Paris, a flurry of new sites.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Forget the arrondissements of Paris. Now, &#xCE;le-de-France, the district that encompasses the city and its outskirts, has become a destination in its own right, one that will welcome tourists back after the week&apos;s violence there. The outward expansion began in 2012 with Larry Gagosian&#x2019;s 17,760-square-foot gallery<a href="http://www.gagosian.com/exhibitions/le-jardin-dcompos%E2%80%94decomposed-garden--october-29-2014"> Gagosian Le Bourget</a>, seven miles north of Montmartre, and<a href="http://ropac.net"> Galerie Thaddaeus Ropac Paris Pantin</a>, housed in a former factory. Fall 2014 saw the opening of Frank Gehry&#x2019;s <a href="http://www.fondationlouisvuitton.fr"> Fondation Louis Vuitton</a>, in the Bois de Boulogne, with its dazzling facade outside and pieces by Ellsworth Kelly and Olafur Eliasson inside. At the other end of Boulogne,<a href="http://www.mgallery.com/gb/hotel-7326-hotel-molitor-paris-mgallery-collection/index.shtml"> the Molitor</a>, a derelict 1960s swimming hall turned art-stuffed hotel, offers upscale lodging. The 2,400-seat<a href="http://www.philharmoniedeparis.fr"> Philharmonie de Paris</a>&#x2019;s Grande Salle, designed by Jean Nouvel, is scheduled to open this year in Parc de la Villette &#x2014; just barely inside the P&#xE9;riph&#xE9;rique.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Adam H. Graham</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The Fondation Louis Vuitton.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Bertrand Guay/AFP, via Getty Images
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="paris" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/paris-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=paris" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Île-de-France">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Île-de-France is No. 42 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/paris-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Île-de-France" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Île-de-France: Beyond the Périphérique of Paris, a flurry of new sites. / #42 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/paris-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Île-de-France">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825407477516358">What parts of Île-de-France do you love?</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825407477516358">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Château de Versailles, the old city of Versailles, Château de Vincennes...” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>

  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">42.</span> Île-de-France</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Beyond the Périphérique of Paris, a flurry of new sites.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Forget the arrondissements of Paris. Now, &#xCE;le-de-France, the district that encompasses the city and its outskirts, has become a destination in its own right, one that will welcome tourists back after the week&apos;s violence there. The outward expansion began in 2012 with Larry Gagosian&#x2019;s 17,760-square-foot gallery<a href="http://www.gagosian.com/exhibitions/le-jardin-dcompos%E2%80%94decomposed-garden--october-29-2014"> Gagosian Le Bourget</a>, seven miles north of Montmartre, and<a href="http://ropac.net"> Galerie Thaddaeus Ropac Paris Pantin</a>, housed in a former factory. Fall 2014 saw the opening of Frank Gehry&#x2019;s <a href="http://www.fondationlouisvuitton.fr"> Fondation Louis Vuitton</a>, in the Bois de Boulogne, with its dazzling facade outside and pieces by Ellsworth Kelly and Olafur Eliasson inside. At the other end of Boulogne,<a href="http://www.mgallery.com/gb/hotel-7326-hotel-molitor-paris-mgallery-collection/index.shtml"> the Molitor</a>, a derelict 1960s swimming hall turned art-stuffed hotel, offers upscale lodging. The 2,400-seat<a href="http://www.philharmoniedeparis.fr"> Philharmonie de Paris</a>&#x2019;s Grande Salle, designed by Jean Nouvel, is scheduled to open this year in Parc de la Villette &#x2014; just barely inside the P&#xE9;riph&#xE9;rique.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Adam H. Graham</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-danang" class="g-story "
  data-slug="danang">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-danang_219"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/danang-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">43.</span> Danang, Vietnam</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A coastal gateway becomes a destination in its own right.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;For the last couple of decades, Danang, on the central coast of Vietnam, has been the place travelers flew into to get to historic Hoi An, a Unesco-protected but tourist-swarmed neighbor 20 miles to the south. But this city of almost a million people has become a worthy destination in its own right. After an airport expansion in 2011, resorts began popping up along the coast. Last year, two luxury lodgings were added:<a href="http://www.accorhotels.com/gb/hotel-9530-premier-village-danang-resort-managed-by-accor/index.shtml"> Premier Village</a> and<a href="http://alacarteliving.com"> A La Carte Danang Beach</a>. And Danang&#x2019;s charms &#x2014; long, sandy beaches and kiosks selling bahn mi sandwiches overflowing with pork and pickled papaya and fresh herbs &#x2014; are even easier to reach since Dragon Air began direct flights from Hong Kong in 2013.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">David Farley</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The Marble Mountains rise up from Danang.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Joel Collins
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="danang" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/danang-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=danang" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Danang, Vietnam">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Danang, Vietnam is No. 43 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/danang-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Danang, Vietnam" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Danang, Vietnam: A coastal gateway becomes a destination in its own right. / #43 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/danang-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Danang, Vietnam">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825407694183003">Do you know Danang? Tell us what to see. </a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825407694183003">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Marble Mountain has amazing views. Be sure to see the Dragon Bridge at night and then enjoy a beer at the Bamboo Bar.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">43.</span> Danang, Vietnam</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A coastal gateway becomes a destination in its own right.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;For the last couple of decades, Danang, on the central coast of Vietnam, has been the place travelers flew into to get to historic Hoi An, a Unesco-protected but tourist-swarmed neighbor 20 miles to the south. But this city of almost a million people has become a worthy destination in its own right. After an airport expansion in 2011, resorts began popping up along the coast. Last year, two luxury lodgings were added:<a href="http://www.accorhotels.com/gb/hotel-9530-premier-village-danang-resort-managed-by-accor/index.shtml"> Premier Village</a> and<a href="http://alacarteliving.com"> A La Carte Danang Beach</a>.   <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/asia/vietnam/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Vietnam Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="danang" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/danang-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=danang" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Danang, Vietnam">

    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Danang, Vietnam">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      </div>
      <div class="g-tools">
        <div class="g-map"><img 
id="g-map-danang_222"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-map"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-src="http://int.nyt.com/newsgraphics/2014/20140216-places-to-go/v21_r9/danang_thumb.png"

></div>
      </div> <!-- .g-tools -->
    </div> <!-- .g-content-container -->


    
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825407694183003">Do you know Danang? Tell us what to see. </a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825407694183003">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Marble Mountain has amazing views. Be sure to see the Dragon Bridge at night and then enjoy a beer at the Bamboo Bar.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>

</div> <!-- .g-story -->

    
      <div id="g-story-chengdu" class="g-story g-hasVideo"
  data-slug="chengdu">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-chengdu_224"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/chengdu-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">44.</span> Chengdu, China</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A panda and food capital gets the upscale treatment.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;Pandas are <a href="http://www.panda.org.cn/english/">this city&#x2019;s drawing card</a>, but adventurous chefs and boutique hotels are now giving visitors a reason to linger after seeing the star residents. Chengdu&#x2019;s food is known for its fire, but at restaurants like Yu Zhi Lan, where an exquisite 20-course meal is served on the chef&#x2019;s homemade pottery, it&#x2019;s also refined. The hotels have a new sophistication, too. <a href="http://thetemplehousehotel.com/en/">Temple House</a>, a Swire Hotels property opening early this year, follows the success of Opposite House in Beijing and Upper House in Hong Kong, mixing modern Chinese design with the preservation of courtyard buildings from the Qing dynasty. Getting to Chengdu is also faster since United&#x2019;s introduction last year of direct flights from San Francisco &#x2014; the first from the continental United States.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Justin Bergman</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: People's Park in Chengdu. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              David Maurice Smith for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="chengdu" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/chengdu-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=chengdu" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Chengdu, China">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Chengdu, China is No. 44 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/chengdu-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Chengdu, China" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>

    </li>

  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825408064182966">What did we miss in Chengdu? Share your tips. 
</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825408064182966">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Chengdu is also known for its incredible panda zoo, where you can enter the cage of giant pandas to pet and feed them carrots.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>

    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">44.</span> Chengdu, China</h3>

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A panda and food capital gets the upscale treatment.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;Pandas are <a href="http://www.panda.org.cn/english/">this city&#x2019;s drawing card</a>, but adventurous chefs and boutique hotels are now giving visitors a reason to linger after seeing the star residents. Chengdu&#x2019;s food is known for its fire, but at restaurants like Yu Zhi Lan, where an exquisite 20-course meal is served on the chef&#x2019;s homemade pottery, it&#x2019;s also refined. The hotels have a new sophistication, too. <a href="http://thetemplehousehotel.com/en/">Temple House</a>, a Swire Hotels property opening early this year, follows the success of Opposite House in Beijing and Upper House in Hong Kong, mixing modern Chinese design with the preservation of courtyard buildings from the Qing dynasty. Getting to Chengdu is also faster since United&#x2019;s introduction last year of direct flights from San Francisco &#x2014; the first from the continental United States.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Justin Bergman</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-miamibeach" class="g-story "
  data-slug="miamibeach">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-miamibeach_229"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/miamibeach-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">45.</span> Miami Beach, Florida</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A white-sand spot is getting seriously fancy. </p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>After months of buzz, the<a href="http://www.faena.com/"> Faena District</a> will finally welcome visitors in the summer. This sprawling development, spanning six blocks north of South Beach, includes residential towers, a hotel and an arts center, all promising unprecedented splendor. It was conceived by the Argentine tastemaker Alan Faena, a man with enough clout to tap the architects Norman Foster and Rem Koolhaas, as well as the film director Baz Luhrmann and his set-designer wife, Catherine Martin, to bring the project to life. But these are not the only boldface names contributing to the area&#x2019;s revamp. The hoteliers Ian Schrager and Jason Pomeranc designed gleaming new properties&#x2014;<a href="http://www.editionhotels.com/miami-beach"> Edition</a> and<a href="http://www.sixtyhotels.com/nautilussouthbeach"> Nautilus</a>, respectively &#x2014; and the fashion designer Tommy Hilfiger just purchased the 1940s<a href="http://raleighhotel.com/"> Raleigh hotel</a> with plans to refresh its classic glamour.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Paola Singer</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The city's Atlantic coastline. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Jonathan Pozniak/Gallerystock
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="miamibeach" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/miamibeach-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=miamibeach" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Miami Beach, Florida">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Miami Beach, Florida is No. 45 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/miamibeach-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Miami Beach, Florida" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Miami Beach, Florida: A white-sand spot is getting seriously fancy.  / #45 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/miamibeach-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Miami Beach, Florida">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>

    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825408337516272">What do you love to do in Miami?

    </h4>

Plunge in the ice cold pool, then warm up poolside as you feel your worries melt away.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>

    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">45.</span> Miami Beach, Florida</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A white-sand spot is getting seriously fancy. </p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>After months of buzz, the<a href="http://www.faena.com/"> Faena District</a> will finally welcome visitors in the summer. This sprawling development, spanning six blocks north of South Beach, includes residential towers, a hotel and an arts center, all promising unprecedented splendor. It was conceived by the Argentine tastemaker Alan Faena, a man with enough clout to tap the architects Norman Foster and Rem Koolhaas, as well as the film director Baz Luhrmann and his set-designer wife, Catherine Martin, to bring the project to life. But these are not the only boldface names contributing to the area&#x2019;s revamp. The hoteliers Ian Schrager and Jason Pomeranc designed gleaming new properties&#x2014;<a href="http://www.editionhotels.com/miami-beach"> Edition</a> and<a href="http://www.sixtyhotels.com/nautilussouthbeach"> Nautilus</a>, respectively &#x2014; and the fashion designer Tommy Hilfiger just purchased the 1940s<a href="http://raleighhotel.com/"> Raleigh hotel</a> with plans to refresh its classic glamour.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Paola Singer</span></p>

  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/north-america/united-states/florida/miami/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Miami Coverage</a></li>

      <div id="g-story-shanghai" class="g-story "
  data-slug="shanghai">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-shanghai_234"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/shanghai-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">46.</span> Shanghai</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A cultural awakening in a city both glitzy and historic.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>The knock on Chinese museums is that they look impressive on the outside, but the art isn&#x2019;t worth the price of admission. This is changing in Shanghai, thanks to the opening of several private museums with curatorial aspirations to match the beautiful facades. Last March, the collectors Liu Yiqian and Wang Wei, known for their attention-grabbing <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/27/arts/design/chinese-artwork-brings-auction-record-of-45-million.html">art auction purchases</a>, opened the <a href="http://thelongmuseum.org">Long Museum (West Bund)</a>, which was followed two months later by the <a href="http://www.yuzmshanghai.org">Yuz Museum</a>, exhibiting installation works in an airport hangar converted by the Japanese architect Sou Fujimoto. In November came yet another: the <a href="http://21msms.com">21st Century Minsheng Art Museum</a>, in the former French pavilion from the 2010 World Expo.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Justin Bergman</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The village Zhouzhuang, near Shanghai.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Liron Almog/Redux
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="shanghai" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/shanghai-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=shanghai" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Shanghai">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Shanghai is No. 46 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/shanghai-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Shanghai" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Shanghai">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>

    </li>

  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825408684182904">What did we miss in Shanghai? Share your tips. 
</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825408684182904">On Facebook, a reader said:  “The Urban Planning building off People's Park has a whole-floor scale model of Shanghai that is enormously helpful in figuring out where you are and the relationship of districts and neighborhoods.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">46.</span> Shanghai</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/shanghai-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/shanghai-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Shanghai">
          </noscript>

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A cultural awakening in a city both glitzy and historic.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>The knock on Chinese museums is that they look impressive on the outside, but the art isn&#x2019;t worth the price of admission. This is changing in Shanghai, thanks to the opening of several private museums with curatorial aspirations to match the beautiful facades. Last March, the collectors Liu Yiqian and Wang Wei, known for their attention-grabbing <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/27/arts/design/chinese-artwork-brings-auction-record-of-45-million.html">art auction purchases</a>, opened the <a href="http://thelongmuseum.org">Long Museum (West Bund)</a>, which was followed two months later by the <a href="http://www.yuzmshanghai.org">Yuz Museum</a>, exhibiting installation works in an airport hangar converted by the Japanese architect Sou Fujimoto. In November came yet another: the <a href="http://21msms.com">21st Century Minsheng Art Museum</a>, in the former French pavilion from the 2010 World Expo.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Justin Bergman</span></p>

  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/asia/china/shanghai/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Shanghai Coverage</a></li>
</ul>

      <div id="g-story-tulsa" class="g-story "
  data-slug="tulsa">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-tulsa_239"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/tulsa-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">47.</span> Tulsa, Oklahoma</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A Deco downtown leads a revival. </p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;When the rest of the country was still recovering from the Great Recession, Tulsa was flush with oil money. Its historic Art Deco city center received a much needed investment boom, fueling two major new museums opening in the Brady Arts District in 2013 and another &#x2014; the <a href="http://www.okpop.org/">OKPop Museum</a>, dedicated to Oklahoma&#x2019;s place in pop culture &#x2014; still to come. Along the Arkansas River riverfront, one of the largest public parks projects in the country broke ground in late 2014. Designed by the architects behind Brooklyn Bridge Park, the $350 million green space will be completed in phases over the next two years. Nearby, the new Route 66 Experience, an interpretive center devoted to the Mother Road, is set to open as early as late 2015.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Freda Moon</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The city's historic Art Deco center.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Christopher Smith/Tulsa World
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="tulsa" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/tulsa-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=tulsa" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Tulsa, Oklahoma">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Tulsa, Oklahoma is No. 47 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/tulsa-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Tulsa, Oklahoma" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">47.</span> Tulsa, Oklahoma</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A Deco downtown leads a revival. </p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;When the rest of the country was still recovering from the Great Recession, Tulsa was flush with oil money. Its historic Art Deco city center received a much needed investment boom, fueling two major new museums opening in the Brady Arts District in 2013 and another &#x2014; the <a href="http://www.okpop.org/">OKPop Museum</a>, dedicated to Oklahoma&#x2019;s place in pop culture &#x2014; still to come. Along the Arkansas River riverfront, one of the largest public parks projects in the country broke ground in late 2014. Designed by the architects behind Brooklyn Bridge Park, the $350 million green space will be completed in phases over the next two years. Nearby, the new Route 66 Experience, an interpretive center devoted to the Mother Road, is set to open as early as late 2015.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Freda Moon</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-rome" class="g-story g-hasVideo"
  data-slug="rome">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-rome_244"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/rome-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">48.</span> Rome, Italy</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Recent restorations of ancient sites beckon.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>No matter your favorite era, Rome has something new for travelers in pursuit of history. To commemorate last year&#x2019;s 2,000th anniversary of Augustus&#x2019;s death, sites related to the first emperor have been refurbished and reopened to the public: In September, the<a href="http://archeoroma.beniculturali.it/en/node/1161"> Palatine Museum</a>, which showcases objects excavated from Imperial palaces, reopened, and the<a href="http://archeoroma.beniculturali.it/en/node/164"> Villa of Livia</a> in suburban Prima Porta unveiled refreshed artworks and new exhibition space. Elsewhere, restoration of the<a href="http://archeoroma.beniculturali.it/en/archaeological-site/pyramid-caius-cestius"> Pyramid of Gaius Cestius</a>, an Augustan-era funeral monument, concluded late last year. Nero&#x2019;s Domus Aurea, a sprawling first-century villa, partly reopened in October and will<a href="http://www.coopculture.it/en/events.cfm?id=268"> welcome visitors</a> at least until March. A more recent monument, the 18th-century Trevi Fountain, is being<a href="http://www.restaurofontanaditrevi.it/en/fendi-for-fountains"> restored by Fendi</a>; completion is scheduled for the fall.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Katie Parla</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The Temple of Saturn.</span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Nadia Shira Cohen for the New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="rome" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/rome-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=rome" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Rome, Italy">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Rome, Italy is No. 48 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/rome-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Rome, Italy" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Rome, Italy: Recent restorations of ancient sites beckon. / #48 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/rome-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Rome, Italy">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825448857512220">What do you love to do in Rome?</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825448857512220">On Facebook, a reader said:  “A wonderful place to see is the Non-Catholic Cemetery, resting place of many artists and writers such as John Keats, Percy Bysshe Shelley and Gregory Corso.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">48.</span> Rome, Italy</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/rome-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/rome-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Rome, Italy">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-rome_243"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/rome-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"
>
          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">The Temple of Saturn.</span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                  <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                  Nadia Shira Cohen for the New York Times
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        
          <figure
            class="g-figure-video"
            itemprop="associatedMedia"
            itemscope=""
            itemid=""
            itemtype="http://schema.org/VideoObject"
            aria-label="media"
            role="group">
            <span class="visually-hidden">Video Player</span>
            <noscript>
              <video autoplay="" loop="" muted="" preload="none" poster="">
                  <source id="mp4" src="" type="video/mp4">
                  <img src="">
              </video>
            </noscript>
            <!-- laziestloader container -->
<div 
id="g-media-rome_246"
data-ratio="0.66666667"
data-slug="rome"
class="g-lazy-video g-lazy-media">
  <!-- vhs container -->
  <div id="g-media-rome_246_vhs" class="g-vhs"></div>
</div>

            <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
                <span class="g-caption-text">The ruins of the Domus Augustana on Palatine Hill.</span>
                <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                    <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                    Nadia Shira Cohen for The New York Times
                </span>
            </figcaption>
          </figure>
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Recent restorations of ancient sites beckon.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>No matter your favorite era, Rome has something new for travelers in pursuit of history. To commemorate last year&#x2019;s 2,000th anniversary of Augustus&#x2019;s death, sites related to the first emperor have been refurbished and reopened to the public: In September, the<a href="http://archeoroma.beniculturali.it/en/node/1161"> Palatine Museum</a>, which showcases objects excavated from Imperial palaces, reopened, and the<a href="http://archeoroma.beniculturali.it/en/node/164"> Villa of Livia</a> in suburban Prima Porta unveiled refreshed artworks and new exhibition space. Elsewhere, restoration of the<a href="http://archeoroma.beniculturali.it/en/archaeological-site/pyramid-caius-cestius"> Pyramid of Gaius Cestius</a>, an Augustan-era funeral monument, concluded late last year. Nero&#x2019;s Domus Aurea, a sprawling first-century villa, partly reopened in October and will<a href="http://www.coopculture.it/en/events.cfm?id=268"> welcome visitors</a> at least until March. A more recent monument, the 18th-century Trevi Fountain, is being<a href="http://www.restaurofontanaditrevi.it/en/fendi-for-fountains"> restored by Fendi</a>; completion is scheduled for the fall.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Katie Parla</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/europe/italy/rome/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Rome Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="rome" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/rome-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=rome" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Rome, Italy">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Rome, Italy is No. 48 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/rome-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>

      <div id="g-story-caceres" class="g-story "
  data-slug="caceres">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-caceres_249"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/caceres-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">49.</span> Cáceres, Spain</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Where history,  art and gastronomy meet.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Cultured gastronomes are rushing to C&#xE1;ceres, an ancient walled city &#x2014; and Unesco World Heritage site &#x2014; blending Roman, Moorish, Gothic and Renaissance architecture halfway between Madrid and Lisbon. The buzz is all about food and art and started with the opening of <a href="http://restauranteatrio.com">Atrio</a>, a breathtaking modernist hotel and restaurant (with two Michelin stars and perhaps the best wine cellar in Europe) artfully inserted into a historic honey-colored stone structure in the old city. Now with C&#xE1;ceres reigning as Spain&#x2019;s Gastronomic Capital for 2015, everyone is upping their game, especially the bustling tapas joints around the newly restored Plaza Mayor. A new arts center showcases the collection of cutting-edge contemporary art donated by the renowned Madrid dealer <a href="http://fundacionhelgadealvear.com">Helga de Alvear</a>.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Andrew Ferren</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Wild asparagus at the restaurant Atrio. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Carles Allende
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="caceres" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/caceres-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=caceres" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Cáceres, Spain">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Cáceres, Spain is No. 49 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/caceres-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Cáceres, Spain" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Cáceres, Spain">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>

    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">49.</span> Cáceres, Spain</h3>

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Where history,  art and gastronomy meet.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Cultured gastronomes are rushing to C&#xE1;ceres, an ancient walled city &#x2014; and Unesco World Heritage site &#x2014; blending Roman, Moorish, Gothic and Renaissance architecture halfway between Madrid and Lisbon. The buzz is all about food and art and started with the opening of <a href="http://restauranteatrio.com">Atrio</a>, a breathtaking modernist hotel and restaurant (with two Michelin stars and perhaps the best wine cellar in Europe) artfully inserted into a historic honey-colored stone structure in the old city. Now with C&#xE1;ceres reigning as Spain&#x2019;s Gastronomic Capital for 2015, everyone is upping their game, especially the bustling tapas joints around the newly restored Plaza Mayor. A new arts center showcases the collection of cutting-edge contemporary art donated by the renowned Madrid dealer <a href="http://fundacionhelgadealvear.com">Helga de Alvear</a>.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Andrew Ferren</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-taos" class="g-story "
  data-slug="taos">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-taos_254"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/taos-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">50.</span> Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">A ski destination heads to the big leagues.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>&#xAD;Despite its rugged scenery and Old World Alpine charm, Taos Ski Valley has been outshone by its megaresort competitors. But with the ski area&#x2019;s sale last December &#x2014; from the Blake family, who founded it 60 years ago, to the billionaire hedge fund manager Louis Bacon &#x2014; <a href="http://www.skitaos.org/">the resort</a> is getting a much-needed shot in the arm. The most notable change this winter is the addition of a chairlift to 12,481-foot-tall Kachina Peak, opening up expert runs that had been reachable only by hiking, skis in hand, for 45 minutes, from the top-of-mountain ski patrol headquarters. In addition, trees were thinned in the Wild West glades, opening up 35 acres of new tree skiing. Significantly, Taos has also invested in its snowmaking, with a huge upgrade that will allow the area to open more terrain earlier. Meanwhile, the base village got its first round of upgrades this summer, with a renovated day lodge and some reconfiguration of shops and restaurants. Visit while it&#x2019;s still manageable.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Cindy Hirschfeld</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Steep terrain at Taos Ski Valley. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Liam Doran
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="taos" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/taos-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=taos" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico is No. 50 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/taos-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico: A ski destination heads to the big leagues. / #50 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/taos-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825410864182686">What are your favorite things to do in Taos Ski Valley?</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825410864182686">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Abe's for breakfast on your way to the mountain!” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
  

    </div>
  </div>


  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">50.</span> Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/taos-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/taos-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-taos_253"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/taos-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"
>
          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">Steep terrain at Taos Ski Valley. </span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                  <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                  Liam Doran
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">A ski destination heads to the big leagues.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>&#xAD;Despite its rugged scenery and Old World Alpine charm, Taos Ski Valley has been outshone by its megaresort competitors. But with the ski area&#x2019;s sale last December &#x2014; from the Blake family, who founded it 60 years ago, to the billionaire hedge fund manager Louis Bacon &#x2014; <a href="http://www.skitaos.org/">the resort</a> is getting a much-needed shot in the arm. The most notable change this winter is the addition of a chairlift to 12,481-foot-tall Kachina Peak, opening up expert runs that had been reachable only by hiking, skis in hand, for 45 minutes, from the top-of-mountain ski patrol headquarters. In addition, trees were thinned in the Wild West glades, opening up 35 acres of new tree skiing. Significantly, Taos has also invested in its snowmaking, with a huge upgrade that will allow the area to open more terrain earlier. Meanwhile, the base village got its first round of upgrades this summer, with a renovated day lodge and some reconfiguration of shops and restaurants. Visit while it&#x2019;s still manageable.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Cindy Hirschfeld</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/north-america/united-states/new-mexico/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent New Mexico Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="taos" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/taos-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=taos" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico is No. 50 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/taos-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico: A ski destination heads to the big leagues. / #50 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/taos-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>

      <div id="g-story-baku" class="g-story "
  data-slug="baku">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-baku_259"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/baku-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">51.</span> Baku, Azerbaijan</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Oil fuels an architecture and tourism boom.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Baku&#x2019;s mix of ancient culture and Dubai-style extravagance is putting it on the tourist map at last. A second oil boom &#x2014; the first was in the early 20th century &#x2014; in the Azeri capital has brought enormous wealth to this city on the shores of the Caspian Sea, and with it, a new skyline. The government has recently been converting oil money into rich architectural projects that encircle the Unesco-protected walled historical center. Eye-catching additions include the Flame Towers, three tongue-shaped 600-foot-tall skyscrapers (one housing a<a href="http://www.fairmont.com/Baku"> Fairmont Hotel</a>), flames dancing on their facades, and the undulating white waves of the Zaha Hadid-designed Heydar Aliyev Center. New luxury hotels include a<a href="http://www.fourseasons.com/baku/"> Four Seasons</a>,<a href="http://www.hilton.com/baku"> Hilton</a> and<a href="http://www.kempinski.com/Baku"> Kempinski</a>; this summer, the 33-floor sail-like Trump International Hotel &amp; Tower Baku will join them &#x2014; and just in time for the very first<a href="http://www.baku2015.com/"> European Games</a>, a multi-sport Olympics-like event, taking place in June.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">David Farley</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: The Old City, with the Flame Towers in the distance. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="baku" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/baku-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=baku" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Baku, Azerbaijan">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Baku, Azerbaijan is No. 51 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/baku-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Baku, Azerbaijan" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Baku, Azerbaijan">

    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Oil fuels an architecture and tourism boom.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Baku&#x2019;s mix of ancient culture and Dubai-style extravagance is putting it on the tourist map at last. A second oil boom &#x2014; the first was in the early 20th century &#x2014; in the Azeri capital has brought enormous wealth to this city on the shores of the Caspian Sea, and with it, a new skyline. The government has recently been converting oil money into rich architectural projects that encircle the Unesco-protected walled historical center. Eye-catching additions include the Flame Towers, three tongue-shaped 600-foot-tall skyscrapers (one housing a<a href="http://www.fairmont.com/Baku"> Fairmont Hotel</a>), flames dancing on their facades, and the undulating white waves of the Zaha Hadid-designed Heydar Aliyev Center. New luxury hotels include a<a href="http://www.fourseasons.com/baku/"> Four Seasons</a>,<a href="http://www.hilton.com/baku"> Hilton</a> and<a href="http://www.kempinski.com/Baku"> Kempinski</a>; this summer, the 33-floor sail-like Trump International Hotel &amp; Tower Baku will join them &#x2014; and just in time for the very first<a href="http://www.baku2015.com/"> European Games</a>, a multi-sport Olympics-like event, taking place in June.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">David Farley</span></p>

      <div id="g-story-kas" class="g-story "
  data-slug="kas">

  <!-- COLLAPSED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-collapsed">

    <div class="g-thumb"><img 
id="g-media-kas_264"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/square_images/kas-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 500, 640]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">52.</span> Kas, Turkey</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin">Priced off the Greek Isles? Try southern Turkey.</p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>Kos is out. Kas is in.<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/27/opinion/greeces-economic-and-political-traps.html?_r=0"> Economic cataclysm</a> in Greece aside, prices remain high on the Greek islands, which increasingly have less to offer the all-inclusive-resort-averse tourist. Enter the Mediterranean coast of Turkey, and its gem, Kas. While the nearby town of Kalkan has<a href="http://www.express.co.uk/life-style/property/331412/Turkey-s-Little-Britain"> fallen</a><a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/article-2554166/Turkey-holidays-Kalkan-Klassy-act.html"> victim</a> to hordes of hard-partying Brits (many a Kalkan restaurant now serves &quot;Full English&quot; brekkies), the old fishing village of Kas remains relatively untouched. Known largely as a<a href="http://www.kas-travel.com/eng/diving.html"> divers&#x2019; paradise</a>, the city has a hippyish sensibility, partly owing to a number of jazz-playing waterfront watering holes. Visitors interested in the past can use Kas as a base for visits to the nearby Lycian cities of Patara and Xanthos.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Katie Engelhart</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: Kas, a diver's paradise on the Mediterranean. </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Rob Hammer/Aurora Photos
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="kas" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/kas-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=kas" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Kas, Turkey">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Kas, Turkey is No. 52 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/kas-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Kas, Turkey" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share pinterest" data-cs-text="Kas, Turkey: Priced off the Greek Isles? Try southern Turkey. / #52 on @nytimes's list of 52 Places to Go in 2015" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/vertical_images/kas-735.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share email" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Kas, Turkey">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-email-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
  </ul>



      
  
  <div class="g-facebookthread">
    <h4>
      <a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825410267516079">What did we miss in Kas? Share your tips.</a> 
    </h4>
    
      <p class="g-facebookthread-comment"><a href="https://www.facebook.com/nytimestravel/posts/825410267516079">On Facebook, a reader said:  “Trekking in Lycian Way, river canoeing, canyoning, sea kayaking, paragliding etc. Kas is a must for nature lovers.” <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-xsmall"></span></a></p>
    
  </div>
