  <!-- EXPANDED VIEW -->
  <div class="g-view-expanded">
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">52.</span> Kas, Turkey</h3>

    <div class="g-media-container">
      <div class="g-media">

        <!-- Image -->
        <figure
          class="g-figure-image"
          itemprop="associatedMedia"
          itemscope=""
          itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/kas-900.jpg"
          itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject"
          aria-label="media"
          role="group">
          <span class="visually-hidden">Photo</span>
          <noscript>
            <img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/kas-900.jpg" alt="Photo of Kas, Turkey">
          </noscript>
          <img 
id="g-media-kas_263"
class="g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place"
src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png"
data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/kas-{{size}}.jpg"
data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"
>
          <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
              <span class="g-caption-text">Kas, a diver's paradise on the Mediterranean. </span>
              <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
                  <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
                  Rob Hammer/Aurora Photos
              </span>
          </figcaption>
        </figure>

        <!-- Video -->
        

      </div> <!-- .g-media -->
    </div> <!-- .g-media-container -->

    
    <div class="g-content-container">
      <p class="g-leadin">Priced off the Greek Isles? Try southern Turkey.</p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>Kos is out. Kas is in.<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/27/opinion/greeces-economic-and-political-traps.html?_r=0"> Economic cataclysm</a> in Greece aside, prices remain high on the Greek islands, which increasingly have less to offer the all-inclusive-resort-averse tourist. Enter the Mediterranean coast of Turkey, and its gem, Kas. While the nearby town of Kalkan has<a href="http://www.express.co.uk/life-style/property/331412/Turkey-s-Little-Britain"> fallen</a><a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/article-2554166/Turkey-holidays-Kalkan-Klassy-act.html"> victim</a> to hordes of hard-partying Brits (many a Kalkan restaurant now serves &quot;Full English&quot; brekkies), the old fishing village of Kas remains relatively untouched. Known largely as a<a href="http://www.kas-travel.com/eng/diving.html"> divers&#x2019; paradise</a>, the city has a hippyish sensibility, partly owing to a number of jazz-playing waterfront watering holes. Visitors interested in the past can use Kas as a base for visits to the nearby Lycian cities of Patara and Xanthos.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">Katie Engelhart</span></p>
        
<ul class="g-related">
  <li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/travel/guides/europe/turkey/overview.html"><span>Related:</span> Recent Turkey Coverage</a></li>
</ul>


        

  <ul class="g-share custom-share-container" data-cs-slug="kas" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/kas-900.jpg" data-cs-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/11/travel/52-places-to-go-in-2015.html?placeId=kas" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Kas, Turkey">
    <li class="custom-share twitter" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015? Kas, Turkey is No. 52 on @NYTimesTravel's list" data-cs-image="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/kas-900.jpg">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-twitter-active g-active-icon"></span>
    </li>
    <li class="custom-share facebook" data-cs-text="Where to go in 2015: Kas, Turkey" data-cs-summary="Explore our list of 52 places to go in 2015, selected by New York Times Travel editors.">
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook g-inactive-icon"></span>
      <span class="g-icon g-icon-facebook-active g-active-icon"></span>

      <span class="g-icon g-icon-pinterest g-inactive-icon"></span>

      </div>

data-widths="[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]"
></div>
    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">53.</span> Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park, Indonesia</h3>
    <p class="g-leadin"></p>
    <div class="g-expand-container">
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-expand"></div>
      <div class="g-icon g-icon-close"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="g-blurb">
      <p>This 2008 trip was to check off an item from my bucket list: witnessing sunrise over the active volcanoes of Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park in East Java, Indonesia. I took a jeep up Mount Penanjakan to get this view of the caldera and smoking Mount Bromo within.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">SUWANDI CHANDRA</span></p>
      <figcaption class="g-caption" itemprop="caption description">
          <span class="g-caption-text">Above: </span>
          <span class="g-credit" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="visually-hidden">Credit</span>
              Suwandi Chandra
          </span>
      </figcaption>
      

      
    </div>
  </div>

    <h3 class="g-title"><span class="g-rank">53.</span> Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park, Indonesia</h3>

      <p class="g-leadin"></p>
      <div class="g-blurb">
        <p>This 2008 trip was to check off an item from my bucket list: witnessing sunrise over the active volcanoes of Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park in East Java, Indonesia. I took a jeep up Mount Penanjakan to get this view of the caldera and smoking Mount Bromo within.<span class="g-reporter-space"> </span><span class="g-reporter">SUWANDI CHANDRA</span></p>

      <p>Tell us which destination tops your list of places to go in 2015. Your suggestion can be somewhere you have been longing to visit, or somewhere you have already been. We will be publishing readers’ Places to Go every month throughout the year.</p>

        <h4>More Coverage</h4>

              <img class="laziest" data-ratio="0.666666" src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png" data-src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/coda_bend-640.jpg">

          </li>
          <li>
            <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/08/travel/places-to-go-archive.html">
              <img class="laziest" data-ratio="0.666666" src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png" data-src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/coda_previous-640.jpg">
              <p>Previous Places to Go</p>
            </a>
          </li>
          <li>
            <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2015/01/11/travel/how-to-travel-in-2015.html">
              <img class="laziest" data-ratio="0.666666" src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png" data-src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/images/coda_waystogo-640.jpg">
              <p>Ways to Go: How to Travel in 2015</p>
            </a>
          </li>
        </ul>
      </div> <!-- more coverage -->
    </div><!-- coda -->

  </div> <!-- 53rd place -->
</div><!-- graphic -->

The history of the valley is dizzying. Various peoples have inhabited it for nearly 5,000 years including the Pueblo, the Hopi and the Navajo; its sheer 1,000-foot-high sandstone walls were desert dunes 225 million years ago. The day we visited, spring-green colors shared the view with clear skies and a sun casting forgiving shadows, even at midday.<span class=\"g-reporter-space\"> </span><span class=\"g-reporter\">STEPHEN RANKIN</span></p>","lazy_image":"<img \nid=\"g-media-canyondechelly_336\"\nclass=\"g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place\"\nsrc=\"http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png\"\ndata-pattern=\"http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/readerschoice_images/canyondechelly-{{size}}.jpg\"\ndata-widths=\"[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]\"\n>","lazy_image_square":"<img \nid=\"g-media-canyondechelly_337\"\nclass=\"g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place\"\nsrc=\"http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png\"\ndata-pattern=\"http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/readerschoice_images/canyondechelly-{{size}}.jpg\"\ndata-widths=\"[240, 320, 640, 720, 900, 1254, 1600, 2200, 2600]\"\n>","lazy_thumb":"<img \nid=\"g-media-canyondechelly_338\"\nclass=\"g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-place\"\nsrc=\"http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png\"\ndata-pattern=\"http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/01/08/places-to-go/assets/readerschoice_thumbs/canyondechelly-{{size}}.jpg\"\ndata-widths=\"[134, 240]\"\n>","lazy_map":"<img \nid=\"g-map-canyondechelly_339\"\nclass=\"g-lazy-image g-lazy-media g-lazy-map\"\nsrc=\"http://graphics8.nytimes.com/packages/flash/multimedia/ICONS/transparent.png\"\ndata-src=\"http://int.nyt.com/newsgraphics/2014/20140216-places-to-go/v21_r9/canyondechelly_thumb.png\"\ndata-src-retina=\"http://int.nyt.com/newsgraphics/2014/20140216-places-to-go/v21_r9/canyondechelly_thumb_2x.png\"\n>"},{"slug":"badlands","name":"South Dakota","date":"7/1/2015","text":"South Dakota is filled with the inspiring spirit of the West.                 <div class="interactive-corrections">
            <div id="addendums" class="addendums">
    <div class="story-addendum story-content theme-correction">
        <strong> Correction: January 25, 2015 </strong> <br/>
    	<p>The cover article on Jan. 11 about 52 places to go in 2015 referred incorrectly to one country that was highlighted. It is Georgia, not the Democratic Republic of Georgia. And an accompanying article about high-speed train services referred incorrectly to Paris-to-Barcelona service. It started in December 2013; it is not beginning service this year.</p>    </div>
    <div class="story-addendum story-content theme-correction">
        <strong> Correction: January 12, 2015 </strong> <br/>
    	<p>An earlier version of this interactive called Manchester England&#8217;s &#8220;second city.&#8221; England&#8217;s second-largest city by population is Birmingham, so Manchester is not England&#8217;s &#8220;second city.&#8221;</p>    </div>

<article id="story" class="story theme-interactive 
    theme-main 
    ">
                
    <header class="story-header interactive-header">
                        <div class="story-meta">
                                                                <div class="kicker-container">
                <h2 class="kicker interactive-kicker">
                                        <span class="kicker-label">
                        <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/pages/world/middleeast/index.html">
                            Middle East                        </a>
                    </span>
                                                                            </h2>
                                    <div id="sharetools-interactive" aria-label="tools" role="group" class="sharetools theme-classic  sharetools-interactive  "
data-shares="show-all|Share"
data-url="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/02/12/world/middleeast/syria-civil-war-damage-maps.html"
data-title="From Syria, an Atlas of a Country in Ruins"
data-author="By SERGIO PEÇANHA and JEREMY WHITE"
data-media="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2015/02/12/world/middleeast/syria-civil-war-damage-maps-1423847241439/syria-civil-war-damage-maps-1423847241439-jumbo.png"
data-description="A satellite image analysis reveals vast devastation in major cities across Syria from the civil war that started nearly four years ago."
	data-publish-date="February 13, 2015"
>
<div class="ad sharetools-inline-article-ad hidden nocontent robots-nocontent">
</div>
</div><!-- close shareTools -->
                            </div>
                                    <h1 class="story-heading interactive-headline" itemprop="headline">From Syria, an Atlas of a Country in Ruins</h1>
            
            <div class="story-meta-footer interactive-meta-footer">
                <div class="interactive-byline">
    <p class="byline-dateline"><span class="byline " itemprop="author creator" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" >By <span class="byline-author" data-byline-name="SERGIO PEÇANHA" itemprop="name">SERGIO PEÇANHA</span> and </span><span class="byline last-byline" itemprop="author creator" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" ><span class="byline-author" data-byline-name="JEREMY WHITE" itemprop="name">JEREMY WHITE</span></span>	<time class="dateline" datetime="March 16"><span class="timestamp">UPDATED </span>March 16</time>
    </p>
</div>
                 <p class="interactive-leadin summary">
            <span class="summary-text">Recent satellite image analysis by Unitar-Unosat, an agency of the United Nations, reveals vast devastation in cities across Syria from the civil war that started nearly four years ago. The four cities below are among those <a href='http://www.unitar.org/unosat/maps/SYR'>analyzed by the agency</a>, which examined images taken before and during the conflict.</span>
    
        		                                </p>
            </div><!-- close story-meta-footer -->

        </div><!-- close story-meta -->
        </header>
    <div id="syria-civil-war-damage-maps" class="interactive-graphic">
        <!--

THIS IS A GENERATED TEMPLATE FILE. DO NOT EDIT.

======================================================

-->
<!-- this file is generated from src/style.css -->

<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/02/11/syria-damage/182fd1c2db4749fa254683d8f5910651cca25d84/build.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/02/11/syria-damage/182fd1c2db4749fa254683d8f5910651cca25d84/resizerStyle.css">

<div class="g-graphics-stack">



<div class="g-lead-photo-container">

  <div class="g-lead-photo" id="g-lead-photo">
    <img class="g-lazy-lead" src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/02/11/syria-damage/182fd1c2db4749fa254683d8f5910651cca25d84/images/transparent.gif" data-pattern="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/02/11/syria-damage/182fd1c2db4749fa254683d8f5910651cca25d84/images/lead-photo-{{size}}.jpg" data-widths="[600, 1050, 1600]" />
  </div>

  <p class="g-source">Bulent Kilic/Agence France-Presse – Getty Images</p>
  <p class="g-caption">The predominantly Kurdish town of Kobani is devastated after months under siege by Islamist forces and airstrikes by a United States-led coalition.</p>

  <p class="g-mobile-leadin">Recent satellite image analysis by Unitar-Unosat, an agency of the United Nations, reveals vast devastation in cities across Syria from the civil war that started nearly four years ago. The four cities below are among those <a href='http://www.unitar.org/unosat/maps/SYR'>analyzed by the agency</a>, which examined images taken before and during the conflict.</p>

</div>

      <div class="g-section-top-text">

        
            <div class="g-section-hed">
              <h2 class="g-desktop-only">Kobani</h2>
            </div>
        

        
            <div class="g-section-copy">
              <p>
                <span class="g-intro">This small town on the border with Turkey was under siege for months as Islamic State fighters and Kurdish forces battled for control. Most of the residents fled to refugee camps in Turkey. The militants were finally pushed out in late January by Kurdish fighters with the help of American-led airstrikes.</span>
                
                
              </p>
            </div>
        

      </div>

      <div class="g-section-top-text">

        
            <div class="g-section-hed">
              <h2 class="g-desktop-only">Aleppo</h2>
            </div>
        

        
            <div class="g-section-copy">
              <p>
                <span class="g-intro">Syria’s largest city was home to more than two million people before the war. Now most of its residents have left, and the city is divided between pro-government forces and rebels. The city center is one of the main fronts. <a href='http://unosat.web.cern.ch/unosat/unitar/downloads/chs/Aleppo.pdf'>An analysis of 210 sites</a> in the city’s old quarters concluded that about half were damaged and one-fifth were destroyed.</span>
                
                
              </p>
            </div>
        

      </div>

            <div class="g-section-hed">
              <h2 class="g-desktop-only">Deir al-Zour</h2>
            </div>
        

        
            <div class="g-section-copy">
              <p>
                <span class="g-intro">The Islamic State now holds most of the city. In December, the Islamists began an offensive to take the airport, which had been used by pro-government forces to launch airstrikes in the region. Airstrikes by the American-led coalition against the Islamic State also hit targets near the city.</span>

	<script async src='http://www.google-analytics.com/ga.js'></script>
	<!-- End ai2html - 2015-03-16 - 13:32 -->
</div>

        
        
      </div>

      <div class="g-section-top-text">

        
            <div class="g-section-hed">
              <h2 class="g-desktop-only">Hama</h2>
            </div>
        

        
            <div class="g-section-copy">
              <p>
                <span class="g-intro">The Syrian government demolished thousands of residential buildings in the suburbs of Hama and Damascus between 2012 and 2013, according to a study by Human Rights Watch. In Hama, the Mashaa al-Arbaeen neighborhood was razed in the fall of 2012. Residents there were perceived by the government as sympathizing with the opposition.</span>
                
                
              </p>
            </div>
        

      </div>

    </div>

    

    

      <div class="g-before-after g-satwidth-large">

        <div class="g-before-after-photos">

          <div class="g-before-photo g-before-after-photo">
            <label>Aug. 2010</label>
            <img class="g-lazy" src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/02/11/syria-damage/182fd1c2db4749fa254683d8f5910651cca25d84/images/transparent.gif" data-src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/02/11/syria-damage/182fd1c2db4749fa254683d8f5910651cca25d84/images/hama-before.png" />
          </div>

          <div class="g-after-photo g-before-after-photo">
            <label>Oct. 2012</label>
            <img class="g-lazy" src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/02/11/syria-damage/182fd1c2db4749fa254683d8f5910651cca25d84/images/transparent.gif" data-src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2015/02/11/syria-damage/182fd1c2db4749fa254683d8f5910651cca25d84/images/hama-after.png" />
          </div>

        </div>

        <p class="g-source">US Department of State, NextView License and European Space Imaging (DigitalGlobe) via Unitar-Unosat</p>
        <p class="g-caption">More than 3,200 buildings that were reduced to rubble in Mashaa al-Arbaeen.</p>


      </div>

    

    

    

    </div>



</div>

</div>

<div class="columnGroup first">				
<h1 itemprop="headline"  class="articleHeadline"><NYT_HEADLINE  version="1.0" type=" ">The Impossible Refugee Boat Lift to Christmas Island</NYT_HEADLINE></h1>     <div class="articleSpanImage"><span itemprop="associatedMedia" itemscope itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2013/11/17/magazine/17refugees1/mag-17Refugees-t_CA0-articleLarge.jpg" itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject">
<img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2013/11/17/magazine/17refugees1/mag-17Refugees-t_CA0-articleLarge.jpg" width="600" height="400" alt="" border="0" itemprop="url" itemid="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2013/11/17/magazine/17refugees1/mag-17Refugees-t_CA0-articleLarge.jpg">
<meta itemprop="identifier" content="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2013/11/17/magazine/17refugees1/mag-17Refugees-t_CA0-articleLarge.jpg" />
<meta itemprop="height" content="600" />
<meta itemprop="width" content="400" />
<div itemprop="copyrightHolder" class="credit">Joel van Houdt for The New York Times</div>
<p itemprop="description" class="caption">Fifty-seven asylum seekers and two Indonesian crew members crossed 200 miles of treacherous water on a 30-foot vessel. </p>
</span>
</div> <!--[if lt IE 8]>

<NYT_BYLINE >
<h6 class="byline">By 
<span itemprop="author creator" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">LUKE MOGELSON</span></span></h6>
</NYT_BYLINE>
<h6 class="dateline">Published: November 15, 2013    </h6>
<div class="shareTools shareToolsThemeClassic articleShareToolsTop"
	data-shares="facebook,twitter,google,save,email,showall|Share,print,singlepage,reprints,ad" 
	data-title="The Impossible Refugee Boat Lift to Christmas Island" 
	data-url="http://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/17/magazine/the-impossible-refugee-boat-lift-to-christmas-island.html" 
	data-description="More than a thousand refugees have died trying to reach Christmas Island. But faced with unbearable conditions at home, they keep coming."></div>

<div class="articleBody">
<span itemprop="copyrightHolder provider sourceOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization" itemid="http://www.nytimes.com">

    <div>
<webonly><p itemprop="articleBody" id="series-lang"><span class="story-credit">By LUKE MOGELSON</span>More than a thousand refugees have died trying to reach Christmas Island. But faced with unbearable conditions at home, they keep coming.<span class="photo-credit">Photographs by <br />JOEL VAN HOUDT</span></p> 
</div>
<div class="articleInline runaroundLeft">
